column1: yTFdhqH9eLzaP05xXQa2rw,I would generally give this place 4 stars
column2: but I think I would like to add an extra star for the friendly service I received. The two times I've been here I've had the meatball and the beef brisket sandwich- very yummy. Overall I think for the price point the sandwiches are delicious and tasty. They have a lot of interesting sauces you can try for your sandwich. The overall experience is great and I will be coming back for my yummy sandwiches. This would also be a fun place to take your family to have a sub and enjoy some subs.,

column1: yTFdhqH9eLzaP05xXQa2rw,I heard of this place from my buddies on Chandler PD as they go there often and told me to try it.  It's a cool theme in there
column2: one I can relate to growing up in and around the firehouse with my dad.  Lots of firetrucks
column3: hoses
column4: and pictures around of firemen.  Lots of hotsauces when you walk in the door - that's nice. Good subs and hoagies and affordably priced - I got a great hot sub for less than what I typically pay for at Subway. And after going to their web site and learning that they have a Foundation where they give money and tools back to First Responders... I'm definitely returning and telling everybody I know about it. And for the record
column5: all the guys and kids working there were really nice.,

column1: yTFdhqH9eLzaP05xXQa2rw,"Arizona's technology sector is expanding yet again. With the presence of Motorola and Intel establishing the Valley's own Silicon Desert
column2: the industry continues to aspire to be a preeminent center of innovation and design. Biotech has garnered much of the attention recently
column3: but even now its perch has been threatened. Yes
column4: in the midst of economic uncertainty
column5: one new firm has no shortage of buzz.  Yes
column6: the cutting edge is now a sandwich knife. Firehouse Subs has come to the state
column7: and promises to revolutionize an American original: the hoagie
column8: or submarine sandwich. Founders Chris and Robin Sorensen realized just like other foods
column9: the method of cooking a sandwich should be just as important as the ingredients. And so
column10: they decided to use a heretofor underutilized way in mass-prodctions sandwich shops: steam.  But if you worry that your glasses will fog up as you walk through the door
column11: don't be. The seemingly endless row of hot sauces will likely cause more eye irration than the patented steamer devices used behind the counter. Bowing to their time the founders worked with their father as firefighters in Jacksonville
column12: Florida
column13: the decor is a mix of bright reds
column14: whites
column15: and blacks with a very clean and new feeling throughout. Employees are quick to shout
column16: \Welcome to Firehouse\"" when anyone steps inside.  The menu hints at ambition but ultimately delivers something more staid. Creative names like \""Hook and Ladder\"" and \""Engine Company\"" conceal prosaic offerings like ham and turkey and turkey with roast beef. But as soon as you take a bite
column17: you'll realize that the steaming does make a huge difference. And you'll also notice how fast you finish
column18: given that their items are on the small side.  With all the focus on next-generation technology
column19: the owners have yet to solve 20th century vintage problems. The first is the wait that is required to use the steamer. While it's not oppressive long
column20: it does diminish the utilty of the sandwich shop concept a little bit. Contravening this is the staff's desire to be really nice to you
column21: even if it's all very Stepford-wife as opposed to something family-owned. We can only hope none there has seen \""Westworld\"".  Innovation
column22: however
column23: always costs money and you'll be keenly aware of this here. It's not that you have to shell out an unspeakable amount of money to dine at Firehouse. It's that you might feel for a simple sandwich
column24: it's either too much (money) or not enough (food). But the restaurant's signature flavors still make it a destination
column25: at least until the next big thing comes along.""",

column1: yTFdhqH9eLzaP05xXQa2rw,This was my first visiting a firehouse sub and I live down the street. The staff has great customer service and very welcoming. It's pretty tough to find parking when I went during lunchtime
column2: but that's manageable. The sandwiches were good
column3: but for the prices it should be bigger!  Definitely a place to go for a quick place to eat during lunchtime.,

column1: yTFdhqH9eLzaP05xXQa2rw,Located right off of Ray and 101
column2: there isn't much parking around here at lunchtime.  It gets a little busy and crowded inside
column3: especially the line for the Coca Cola Freestyle.  Prices are also a little high for the value considering meat quality and quantity.  The lettuce is well shredded from the corporate offices.    I've been here a few times because a friend works nearby so we've met here.  I wouldn't drive here out of my way when there are better alternatives on the other side of 101 or down on Chandler Boulevard.  Staff here is pretty welcoming and not just when you walk in.,

column1: yTFdhqH9eLzaP05xXQa2rw,Good food

column10: this place is worth checking out.  :-),

column1: yTFdhqH9eLzaP05xXQa2rw,The food was great but over priced. The placed was packed yet the service was exceptional which is a rare combination. I would definitely recommend this place place to my friends just remember to save up before you stop in.,
yTFdhqH9eLzaP05xXQa2rw,I got a meatball sub from this location

column1: yTFdhqH9eLzaP05xXQa2rw,"One of the best sub shops hands down. Love the way they steam the subs
column2: make them taste freaking delicious.  Really there isn't any sub on the menu you can't go wrong with. Average prices and the \Welcome to Firehouse\"" never gets old.  Give it a go and head to Firehouse!""",

column1: yTFdhqH9eLzaP05xXQa2rw,"If your a man
column2: this is your sammich shop!!! Its a bit pricey but it seems like most of the sammich places now a days are. The hubby loves this place. He always get \The Hero\"" which he claims is named after him. I tend to get the same thing at most sammich shops which is a turkey sammich
column3: smoked turkey breast in Firehouses case. I will say that this is a decent sammich. The bread and other ingredients always seem to be fresh. However
column4: its not one of those places that I crave for some reason. Honestly

column6: kinda like an old firehouse (imagine that!). They also have some good chocolate chip cookies    :)""",

column1: yTFdhqH9eLzaP05xXQa2rw,Great subs with a good price,

yTFdhqH9eLzaP05xXQa2rw,"I went to Firehouse for the first time this past weekend. The place was clean and I enjoyed the decor.   The sandwiches were very good and fresh. The brisket and cheddar sandwich was really good. I also split the engine company sub with my fiancee and enjoyed the sandwich. The sandwiches were made within 5 minutes of the order.  I liked the crushed ice instead of the cube you typically get at most eating esablishments.   I didn't find the food too expensive. The cost for 2 sandwich combos was $16-17.  About what you would pay at Dilly's.  I expect I will hear \Welcome to Firehouse\"" in the future.""",

column2: let me make it clear I have experience with Firehouse Subs. I'm from the East Coast
column3: where they originate. I had one one block away from my campus housing while I was in college
column4: and another resided in the same building as a friend of mine's condo during that same time.   With that out of the order
column5: Firehouse is good. Very good. A large combo is a little pricier than a deal at Subway (a large combo is ~$10)

column7: but the large is
column8: I feel

column12: however. Don't expect the 'have it your way' mentality of Subway
column13: you have a choice of ~10 subs
column14: each of which comes with a selection of meats and cheeses. Some of these can be served fully involved (mayo
column15: mustard
column16: lettuce
column17: tomato)
column18: others can not (I'm looking at -you-
column19: Steamer. You'd be perfect if you'd just loosen up a bit and take some extra condiments like a good girl). Well
column20: you might be able to explicitly ask if they can be served that way
column21: but it's going to be up to the server
column22: the ones that are to be served fully involved (if you want them that way) say \Served Fully Involved\"" on the menu.  But my God
column23: even with these limits is it worth it. These sandwiches are large
column24: filled with meat and cheese
column25: tasty as hell
column26: and Firehouse provides a huge assortment of hot sauces to include on it. USE THEM! Find one you like
column27: it really does make the sandwich taste better. I nearly cried when I found out a friend had been eating at Firehouse but had never known the hot sauces were there to be tried and experimented with by the customers
column28: and so had never had the joy of a hot sauced sub.  Now
column29: the reason this isn't 5 star...because of what has been done to the Firehouse Subs brand hot sauce. Yes
column30: they have their own. Back in GA
column31: it was -amazing-
column32: best hot sauce there. Mild enough you could slather it on like ketchup
column33: spicy enough to give it some heat
column34: and tangy enough to give it flavor. I'm not sure why the one here was different (different mixing location? Different (bad) batch from those I've had in the past? I don't know)
column35: but it was a little bit spicier than it should have been (making it so my usual habit of slathering it on made the sandwich a little more spicy than I like. Still good
column40: try Firehouse the next time you want a sub. It's so much better than those other

column1: yTFdhqH9eLzaP05xXQa2rw,"The thing that really sets Firehouse Subs apart from its competitors is its amazing service. Even over the noon hour--the busiest time of day--at least one employee greets you at the door. Everyone who works there is cheerful and courteous. They deliver the food to your table
column2: And the food arrives quickly.  The food is consistently flavorful. Their menu is standardized
column3: so if you want a sub made your way
column4: you would be better off at Subway. They will leave off certain ingredients if you ask
column5: but the options are limited. I don't mind this because it makes the line go quicker. You don't wait 20 minutes for the people in front of you to pick their ingredients.  The soda machine with 200+ flavors is way cool. One benefit is that there is normally a single line behind the machine. You don't have people crashing into or cutting in front of each other as happens with traditional soda fountains. I happened to talk recently with a fellow who works for Coca-Cola. He said these machines cost around $17
column7: so any business that has at least one of them must be doing well.  The cashier always asks whether you would like to round up your purchase to the next dollar to benefit the Firehouse Public Safety Foundation. Normally
column8: I dislike it when cashiers ask you to donate to the store's favorite cause because I already give to my own favorite causes. However
column9: I always say \yes\"" at Firehouse because donating to first responders is definitely a good cause
column10: assuming that the money goes where they say it does.  As other reviewers have mentioned
column11: the food is pricey. For a few dollars more
column12: you could get a decent meal at a sit-down restaurant.  Sadly
column13: I no longer eat at Firehouse Subs because I recently became a vegetarian
column14: and they don't offer a vegetarian option. I'm sure they would leave the meat off one of their salads on request
column15: but when I go to a sub place
column16: I want a sub. So I eat at Subway instead
column17: even though the quality
column18: service
column19: and atmosphere are lacking by comparison.  If you are carnivorous
column20: I highly recommend Firehouse Subs.  UPDATE:  After posting this as a four-star review
column21: a representative of Firehouse Subs private messaged me to address a few of the concerns I expressed above. She informed me that they do indeed have a vegetarian sub on the menu. She also explained more about the Firehouse Public Safety Foundation.  Since posting the original review
column22: I have returned to Firehouse Subs in Chandler twice. Each time I ordered the veggie sub. The reason I wasn't aware of it earlier is that it is not on the big menu behind the counter. I found it listed only on a small revolving menu on the countertop. I would suggest that they do more to promote the veggie sub because it's good. It is much more flavorful than its counterpart at Subway. If you order The Works and ask them to skip the mayo
column23: it's fairly healthy.  Also
column24: I want to clarify that in the original review
column25: I did not mean to imply that their Foundation is shady. I was simply trying to be objective
column26: i.e.
column27: I did not want to state something I could not verify. After learning more about the Foundation and reading more about it on the Internet
column28: I think it's well respected and does great work. Certainly
column29: there are few causes more important than helping first responders.  Primarily because I like their veggie sub
column30: I have upped my original rating to five stars. I may be taking some risk in doing so because Yelp seems to be more likely to filter five-star reviews. But I believe the rating was earned.""",

column1: yTFdhqH9eLzaP05xXQa2rw,I love Firehouse Subs.  Soooo delicious!  I'm a regular here because it's close by.  Even if I wasn't close
column2: I'd still be a regular.  I haven't had a bad sub or bad service here yet (knock on wood).  Love the sub card they have
column3: too.  I always enjoy it when a place rewards me for eating there on a regular basis.  They just added a touch screen fountain pop machine
column4: too
column5: which I thought was cool since I'm a computer nerd.  It's not the cheapest place on earth
column6: but that's my only gripe.,

column1: yTFdhqH9eLzaP05xXQa2rw,"\Welcome to Firehouse!\""  Yep
column2: that's an actual quote that I hear nearly every time I walk in. It felt weird at first
column3: but now I miss it when they're too busy to look up.  Pros- -Subs are always made fresh and hot -They come to you
column4: instead of making you wait -Love the pickle  Cons- -Only two choices of bread -Not cheap -Freshness ain't instantaneous  Seeing as how my day job is just across the street. this is my #1 lunch destination.""",

column1: yTFdhqH9eLzaP05xXQa2rw,"I like Firehouse Subs for their premium tasty sandwiches

column1: pAu8UuWTLTLai61TW8-tZw,"I'm not saying Pei Wei is the best asian food I've ever tasted
column2: far from it
column3: it's a fairly large chain that puts on the appearance of something more refined
column4: it's essentially to Asian food what Olive Garden is to Italian Food.  With that said I've always had pretty good experiences with Pei Wei
column5: the food although not spectacular is better than some of the overcooked chicken drowning in MSG offered by some of the local chinese restaurants.  the portions are good sized
column6: the food is generally consistent
column7: and the prices are really reasonable considering this is a corporate chain in some cases cheaper than the local establishments. or dare I say it's name \panda express\"" (which is overpriced crap)  the time before last that I went they forgot the tomato's and the dressing for an asian chopped chicken salad that my wife ordered
column8: I didn't discover that the dressing was missing until I got home
column9: I immediately called the restaurant and was speaking to a manager within 30 seconds. The manager apologized and asked me If I would like to come back to the restaurant or if he could have my address so he could send me a gift certificate. I decided to go back to the restaurant
column10: when I got the restaurant I told the person at the counter my name and they already had a bag set aside for me
column11: the manager came over and explained to me there was another full salad in the bag
column12: and he put additional dressing for the salad we already had
column13: and additionally he gave me a coupon for free lettuce wraps.(which mental note: I need to use)  I must say I was impressed with this manager
column14: and it was refreshing after being in situations where a manager has taken back the bag/plate and essentially \""un-F$@k's\"" your food and returns it to you.  Overall great customer service
column15: consistent food
column16: and a good option for takeout in surprise.""",

column1: pAu8UuWTLTLai61TW8-tZw,Very tasty Chinese food!  The prices are reasonable and serving sizes are generous.  I really enjoyed the Mongolian Beef!  Dont forget to grab a fortune cookie from the bowl on your way out!,

pAu8UuWTLTLai61TW8-tZw,Typical big business chinese place. Slightly fancy but very average food. Kinda like a fast food place.... you walk up and order then get your own drinks etc. Portions are very small. Prices are higher than average.  They offer a few different vegetarian options but it all tastes pretty bad  do yourself a favor and also support a local business and eat at big buddha around the corner. Its much better food,

pAu8UuWTLTLai61TW8-tZw,Went in for lunch with a coworker today. The small portions are overpriced and really aren't small-half would've been more than enough.  We were served quickly and the staff was friendly! The restaurant was clean and tables were bussed quickly.  I was disappointed with my Mongolian chicken. It tasted more like Teriyaki and was swimming in sauce. I had at least a 1/3 cup of sauce left on my plate after eating my food. All in all
column2: PeiWei's food will be why I don't return anytime soon even though their staff was excellent and so was the atmosphere.,

column1: pAu8UuWTLTLai61TW8-tZw,Pei Wei is a fast
column2: easy
column3: cheaper PF Chang's - and that's what makes it great! If you like the tofu dishes at PF Chang's
column4: you'll love Pei Wei. The food here is great. The service is exceptional. And the portions are huge! I usually end up taking about half the food home with me. Also
column5: compared to other lunch spots near by (like Paradise Bakery)
column6: it's really not all that busy. Of course
column7: it's not authentic Asian food
column8: but you shouldn't be expecting that when you come here anyway.,

column1: pAu8UuWTLTLai61TW8-tZw,"Took the family there last week.  Ordered fried wontons
column2: sweet and sour beef
column3: Mongolian beef
column4: honey crusted chicken and pad Thai noodles.    The Mongolian beef was delicious
column5: however the white rice was undercooked
column6: some of the rice was hard still and crunchy.  Honey crusted chicken also quite good
column7: same story with the rice.  Same thing with the sweet and sour beef.  Ordered the Pad Thai without peanuts... Son is allergic to peanuts so we made it very clear we didn't want anything with nuts.  They deliver the pad Thai with peanuts all over the top.  Sent it back and they fixed it.  They brought us spring rolls which we did not order.  We said they were not ours we ordered wontons.  They bring us the wontons a few minutes later.  The wontons are less expensive than the spring rolls
column8: we point that our to the guy at the register and with a bit of smart-alecky-ness says that he \let us keep the spring rolls\"" and \""didn't charge is for all of our drinks\"" as if he did us a favor.  Overall the food was decent
column9: the rice was terrible and the attitude of the cashier was not what I expected with a $65 food order!!  I wouldn't go back for that price and food quality but perhaps we caught them on a bad day..""",

column1: pAu8UuWTLTLai61TW8-tZw,I love how convenient the location is. It's right near stores and other restaurants
column2: as well as neighborhoods. The food is outstanding and the prices are reasonable. I would love to eat here again!,

column1: pAu8UuWTLTLai61TW8-tZw,Wife and I went last week and we should go more often. Sat at the counter watching the Cooks perform their magic
column2: and they are very friendly...Started with the Pork Egg Rolls
column3: a bit overpriced and not enough veggies in the roll... Wife had the Chicken Teriyaki with noodles... Tasted hers and it was very good.. I had the new Thai Lime Chile Beef with brown rice... I could eat there everyday.. O.K. maybe twice a day! The quality is great

column1: pAu8UuWTLTLai61TW8-tZw,Found this the other night.  It is the PF Chang fast food option and it worked perfectly for us.  Limited menu

column3: but clean and fast seating.  Lettuce Wraps just as good as Chang's.  Very busy
column4: especially the take out.  Glad to have it close,

column2: just like locations in ca

column4: you can order a few items and try it all

column1: pAu8UuWTLTLai61TW8-tZw,I ordered the teriyaki bowl and it was great food for the price.  Quite impressed by the variety of options on the menu. Not sure if this location was the one I tried.,
l9Xqi_FUukoExs7nBa422w,"This was my first visit to a Culver's restaurant. My first observation was the outside area
column2: it was clean and litter free with ample parking. The inside was also very clean and neat
column3: as was the bathroom.  The owner of the store personally took my order and he was friendly and very professional. I ordered the \Culvers Deluxe\"" platter
column4: which included fries and a drink. The double meat
column5: double cheese burger came piled high with bacon and fresh veggies. The burger was excellent
column6: hot and plenty of juice. Fries were ok
column7: crispy
column8: could have been more of them. Overall
column9: prices are about average for a burger combo. The food was above average for a fast food joint. The staff was friendly and helpful. I give Culver's a thumbs up and I am sure I will visit them again.""",

column1: l9Xqi_FUukoExs7nBa422w,The good? Well it is better than Pete's.  When my mom was in town this Spring I decided to buy her dinner at Culver's after a few people recommended it. My aunt strongly recommended the seasonal walleye so I went for it.  First off this review is partially my fault. I'm an active Yelper. It is usually my fault when my expectations are off. I expected a casual sit down place like Denny's or Big Boys. So it is my fault for not doing my homework.  Second
column2: it is less fast casual and more fast food. I got the impression from a few people that this was a fast casual place. But it felt more like McDonald's with a few seasonal specials to me.  Third. The food. My wife thought her friend chicken was okay. My walleye was better than Pete's and other fast food joints. But on par with decent fish and chips? No. And it cost more than my last trip to our favorite fish and chips joint.  The restaurant even looked messier than most McDonald's I've been to.  Next time
column3: I'm going to remember to check before offering to treat family to dinner even if I have a recommendation. Because this place was disappointing and I would've rather spent the money to buy some fish
column4: oil
column5: beer
column6: potatoes and make dinner for twice as many people for the same price.,

column1: l9Xqi_FUukoExs7nBa422w,I have eaten there in the past and has been a while.  Food was very good when this restaurant first opened.  Just went there 01/18/2014. I ordered the chicken dinner to go
column2: and it was the worst crap ever.  First the cashier ran back and asked the cook if there was any chicken.  I received 2 legs and  thighs which tasted and looked like it sat under a heat lamp for hours.  For the price your paying u think it would be fresh!  Quality has definitely went down.  Will never again go to this culvers location again.,

column1: MpMkOGrzCEGrO0-8yoib2w,The food is tasty but it's over priced for what you get. Also I'm not really supporting their business much anymore since they have an issue with equality. I notice we don't really have cravings to eat here because we're just reminded of their views and with that disappointment we tend to choose somewhere else to go. Which is sad
column2: since my mom had been taking me to chick-fil-a's since the late 80's! Also
column3: last time we went they were playing Christian music as if they needed to prove something. You should really respect ALL potential customers that could walk through your doors. So much disappointment.,

column1: MpMkOGrzCEGrO0-8yoib2w,My favorite fast-food place.  Great food combined with best-in-class service.  The people are always friendly!  I love their chicken.  It beats KFC
column2: Church's
column3: and anyone else you can name.    I especially appreciate three very unique things about them - 1. They are closed on Sundays.  I admire that!  2. The have a family night on Monday.  Kids get a 4 piece nugget meal with every adult combo meal.  3.  Their kid's meal comes with an EDUCATIONAL game or toy!  Their meal also preaches character instead of the latest Disney or Dreamworks movie - sorry Shrek!  A class A place with great food
column4: great service
column5: and competitve prices.  (Sorry
column6: no dollar menu though.),

column1: MpMkOGrzCEGrO0-8yoib2w,I have always enjoyed the flavor of Chick-Fil-A Chicken.  Although it is pricey
column2: it's well worth the cost.  I get excited everytime I see a new restaurant opening.  I'm not a iced tea drinker so I have never experienced any fungus in my beverage.  That does concern me but I will continue to enjoy their chicken.  Keep up the good work.  I also appreciate a business that stays true to their values over financial gain.,

column1: MpMkOGrzCEGrO0-8yoib2w,"This was my first time in a Chick-Fil-A and I was curious. I came here to wait while my husband was in an interview. I had heard things about them in the news.   Just one dollar sign is in the price range. No way
column2: not even close. For $7
column3: you get a puny salad and a drink. A value meal is ~ $8. Christian or not
column4: it's such a rip-off.   And the girl that served me had a creepy attitude. When I said \thank you\"" to her twice
column5: for ringing me up and bringing me the food
column6: she responded with a weird
column7: melodramatic \""Pleasure...\""  All the 5 stars below must be employees.""",

column1: 58P3oSd8P2QNzHrQmRqQZw,JUNE 2014: It's been a while since I've been in so I thought I would update my review --- FOR THE BETTER! The Codfather serves AUTHENTIC British fish & chips like you would find at the village chippy in England. Authentic texture and flavor
column2: especially with malt vinegar and salt like you should. I've tried everyone else in town with their quirky British names and pub atmospheres
column3: but guess what? Their fish n chips doesn't EVEN compare. I had the tilapia lunch special with an extra piece of fish. The talapia has a different texture and taste than the cod of course. Ask for extra crispy! Crunchy batter is what it's all about! This would work better with the cod since it's a moister fish. The chips are the most authentic as well.  The place has improved GREATLY since I've been there last. You enter at the left door now at the pub area and you're seated by friendly uniformed staff. It used to be that you order at the counter and then seat yourself. Much more like a proper restaurant now which is a big plus. Arrived in time last week for the second half of a World Cup game with England playing. There was absolutely NO OTHER PLACE TO BE for the game! Screens were everywhere.  Also the beer selection has greatly improved. Friday and Saturday still have the all you can eat fish at $12.95 I think. The price went up over the years but hey my original review was 2007. We had to wait a while for our meals but that's OK they were backed up a bit. I'm sure it will be OK when you go. The taste and texture of the fish n chips were PERFECT.,

column1: 58P3oSd8P2QNzHrQmRqQZw,"We visited The Codfather recently
column2: not really knowing what to expect nor really having any preconceived notions
column3: as I hadn't looked on Yelp yet.    First impressions - I was really disappointed that there wasn't more of a pub atmosphere.  The interior is very close to being fast food
column4: and not even as nice as some.  You order at a counter and the food is delivered to your table.  I would agree with the earlier reviewers on some things.  I ordered the large portion of the Cod fish & chips.  I thought the portion size and the fish were quite good.  The batter was crispy and not greasy.  The chips were terrible though.  They were limp
column5: soggy and tasted as if the oil should have been changed about two weeks ago.  I also had some shrimp which were good
column6: but not outstanding.  I too was put off by the cheap \nickel and dime\"" approach - $.25 for more tartar sauce????  And I didn't like the $.35 surcharge for using my debit card.  I thought for a minute I was at ARCO's fish and chips!!     So
column7: the fish was a 4
column8: the chips were a 1
column9: and the decor was maybe a 3.  I have to stretch to give The Codfather a 3 overall.  We will probably keep getting the fish
column10: but for take-out.""",

column1: 58P3oSd8P2QNzHrQmRqQZw,Take a trip to GB without leaving AZ!  If you are looking for the ambience of an English pub
column2: you won't find it here. If you are looking for authentic English pub food
column3: you WILL find it at Codfather's! (We've traveled to the UK many times and enjoyed traditional pub food a lot. I don't consider myself an authority
column4: but I do feel comfortable making the claim that Codfather's is authentic). They even have a little area set aside selling authentic British candy
column5: sauces
column6: teas
column7: biscuits
column8: and more!   Of course
column9: fish and chips is the first thing that comes to min when thinking pub food
column10: and Codfather's does not disappoint. Cod
column11: catfish
column12: Mahi Mahi
column13: salmon
column14: haddock
column15: halibut... grilled or fried? Small or large? One doesn't get that many options in the UK!! Plus
column16: you get a side dish - how about mushy peas or baked beans? So British! Or perhaps you fancy meat: they offer pies
column17: pasties
column18: sausage
column19: etc. And of course
column20: you can get bangers and mash
column21: or bubble and squeak
column22: or a ploughman's platter or even an English breakfast.   The portions sizes are very generous. The small fish and chips is big
column23: the large order is bigger! But the ultimate deciding factor is taste. Again
column24: no disappointment. The fish was fried perfectly
column25: not greasy at all and the batter is delicious. The Cornish pasty was huge (half went home to enjoy the next day.)  The beer selection is awesome
column26: too (some bottled
column27: some on tap.) I've never found John Smith's Extra Smooth anywhere else in town!! In addition to the other UK beers (Boddington's Guinness
column28: Fullers)
column29: they offer domestics such as Bud & Coors (why
column30: I have no idea!!) as well as small selection of wine.  Service was great
column31: prices are very reasonable and friendly/welcoming staff. Don't be deterred by the location - make your way to 16th & Bell
column32: and enjoy great pub food at this family owned restaurant.,

column1: 58P3oSd8P2QNzHrQmRqQZw,"I think John's 10/25/11 review is the most helpful
column2: and so I can only share some of my observations. I think this place would be really cool if it were retro-60's British fish & chips
column3: the sort of place Austin Powers would have gone to. *Contemporary* British is a huge problem for me if it means huge banners of Prince William or Harry or Whoever It Is & What's-Her-Name and God Save The Queen coffee mugs with the queen on it. Huge turn-off for me. I'm just glad they (England) got the 2012 Olympics because that will inevitably make for a more pleasant dining experience.   I don't like LJS's fast-food \fish\"" at all. I did like The Codfather's fish & chips here
column4: tastes much better. I also liked that their silverware (even at lunch) is some damn fine china - especially for a \""fish and chips\"" place.   I do think The Codfather would work better as a \""bar\"" bar ONLY
column5: or a fish & chips place ONLY
column6: because there does seem to be a weird disconnect depending upon where you sit. The whole Sports-Game-on-TV-That-Doesn't-Match-The-Sound-(Music)-You-Hear thing that's common in a lot of places.   Based upon my experience and observations
column7: I don't think The Codfather deserves so many negative reviews. Just doesn't describe The Codfather I went to.     Service: Acceptable/Good  Prices: Reasonable Environment: Will be better once the Olympics happen""",

column1: 58P3oSd8P2QNzHrQmRqQZw,I'm really disappointed that I have to write such a poor review for this place.  I'm not a big fan of fish
column2: but I love it when it's all fried up and served with fries
column3: so I wasn't worried about coming here.  When we walked in
column4: I was a little confused at the setup
column5: but it kind of grew on me.  It was very clearly a mom and pop style place
column6: and I can definitely appreciate that.  The decor was pretty awful
column7: but endearing at the same time.  I'm not sure why they were trying to cover up their wood tabletops with awful cheap tablecloths
column8: but to each their own.  I also liked their impressive selection of British foodstuffs.  I wasn't too hungry
column9: so I ordered the smaller portion of the cod and chips.  I really liked that they gave you the option to order a little less.  Maybe I was under the wrong impression that this should be a faster service restaurant because you order at a counter and pay at the counter
column10: but our food took forever to get out to us.  The unfortunate things was seeing the cook put our fries onto our plate well before the fish made it.  That left us with lukewarm fries.  The fries
column11: well
column12: they sucked.  They weren't the crispy kind and they weren't salted at all.  The fish
column13: I hate to say it
column14: was disgusting.  It was over-battered and wasn't cooked long enough.  That left me with a nasty mess of mush all over my fish.  I had to scrape it all of to be edible.  Since this place calls themselves the Codfather
column15: and I wasn't pleased with what is supposedly their specialty
column16: I certainly don't see myself coming back.,

column1: 58P3oSd8P2QNzHrQmRqQZw,We go here once every few months.  The beer is great and they have a good selection.  The decor seems to struggle to find itself
column2: but if the food is really good
column3: who cares what it looks like.  They have added table service
column4: which was not so great
column5: but the beer was good
column6: so......  Always get the cod fish and chips.  It all seems to cost more than it should
column7: but I don't mind if I am supporting a local business.  The only thing I will remember is to face away from the kitchen space
column8: because you can see everything they are doing in there
column9: it's a bit unnerving and I don't care for having to ask for a key to the restroom.,

column1: 58P3oSd8P2QNzHrQmRqQZw,This place is truly a Gem among Gems...it gets The Highest Review for a few reasons: Great Food. Very authentic English Cod and awesome Pasties!   They also have a mini English-only mart with British snacks (Smarties
column2: Crunchies
column3: Walkers Chips and much more) they EVEN have Barley Water if you're looking for bitterness in a bottle.   The BEST part
column4: however
column5: is the Bar which is NOT very big
column6: but don't let the size and strip-mall feel deceive you
column7: they probably have one of the best and most diverse draft beer selections in town. On Tap is NewCastle
column8: London Pride
column9: & Tetley's as for others they have Smithwicks
column10: Kilt Lifter and they're always rotating great other beers in and out.   They also have a Guinness Surger which takes pure but flat Guinness and sends an ultra-sonic pulse through the pint glass
column11: releasing the gases in the Guinness beer
column12: which then settles into a smooth velvet pint with a creamy head. In my opinion BETTER than Guinness draft
column13: you MUST try one!  They have a very cool Tuesday Open-Mic Night and other nightly specials. It's inexpensive
column14: with a friendly staff and not too far off the 51 or the 101...All around a 5/5!,

column1: 58P3oSd8P2QNzHrQmRqQZw,Fish is very good and the chips are good if you don't get them to go. The bar area has a good selection of beers on tap (Kronenbourg being my favorite) The staff are friendly and the prices reasonable. As other reviewers have said - the decor is simple
column2: and does remind me of Fish and Chip Shops back in England (I am an ex-pat) The grocery section has a decent selection and you can find some decent imported English foods,

column1: 58P3oSd8P2QNzHrQmRqQZw,Great fish & chips... Very very pricey for what u get!  Unless you go on friday... but the Halibut is crazy expensive... One piece for 11 bucks... ??? Yeah....,
58P3oSd8P2QNzHrQmRqQZw,Great fish & chips... Very very pricey for what u get!  Unless you go on friday... but the Halibut is crazy expensive... One piece for 11 bucks... ??? Yeah....,
58P3oSd8P2QNzHrQmRqQZw,Unlike other fish 'n chips places in the city
column2: this one offers other British fare as well: bangers and mash
column3: bubble and squeak
column4: and more (see the menu board pic I posted). I ordered the small cod and small order of fries
column5: plus a crab cake. The fries were cut a bit thicker than you would find at most fast food places (this does have the look of a fast food joint
column6: except for the bar area). I had anticipated mediocre fries at most
column7: having previously read some of the reviews here
column8: but  the batch I got was quite good
column9: crispy outside
column10: moist and tender within. The same description could be applied to the fish - except that the battered cod was swimming in oil
column11: and the fries were not. The crab cake was a good size - about the size of the palm of a hand - and just as thick
column12: had lots of crab meat but also quite a bit of surimi (imitation crab) as an extender. That was OK
column13: it still tasted good and I like surimi. Like the fish
column14: though
column15: it was drenched in oil. I'm thinking of coming back to try the other fare
column16: or even the fish and crab cake again - they're tasty and not expensive. I just need to take the precaution of letting a paper napkin soak up much of the oil first.,

column1: 58P3oSd8P2QNzHrQmRqQZw,Roy 'The Hungry Englishman'  For those of you who are in a rush then my 'Five Star' rating says it all
column2: this place is the best and importantly the most AUTHENTIC 'Chippy' that I have yet to find in the US.  However as is usual with my reviews I feel a little more in-depth comments are warranted so if you feel so inclined here you go.  As you have likely guessed from my moniker I am English born and bred
column3: although  I must say it is my very good fortune to now call this wonderful country my home.  To the surprise of my (American) wife I don't get homesick at all but it is true to say that I do occasionally crave the odd bite or two that I grew up on
column4: fish and chips included.  To this end my ever thoughtful wife has always been keen to find me an 'authentic' fish & chip restaurant as we travel this great country and I can say that finally we found one at the Codfather in Phoenix Arizona of all places.  I have tried so called 'authentic' British fish & chips all over the country and although most have been a very pleasant meal 'authentic' they were certainly not.  For one thing if you mention 'mushy peas' they look at you rather strangely whereas this is likely one of the most common sides you can get at every single 'chippy' in good old Blighty.  And don't get me started on the battered fish (or lack there of)....aside from the batter being wrong so called 'authentic' British fish & chip restaurants here in the US are under the misguided illusion that two 'finger' sized portions of fish is the thing to offer
column5: when anyone who has ever eaten the real thing knows that one always gets a large filet of fish (usually hanging over the edge of your plate).  Anyway enough of my ranting on about all the places that are getting it wrong and let me chat about the ONLY place I have yet found that is getting it totally RIGHT..namely the Codfather.  What can I say.....FINALLY...a real Chippy..!  The place is very unpretentious but pleasant and comfortable
column6: I think the lady owner is British as I heard an accent in the background and sadly the opportunity to introduce myself didn't arise (perhaps next time
column7: cuz you know I'm going back).  I ordered my standby old favorite (fish
column8: chips & mushy peas) and I was not disappointed
column9: everything was just like I grew up on
column10: totally authentic
column11: so much so I over stuffed a little and couldn't eat for the rest of the day.  The 'chippy' also has a little British grocery section in
column12: so I took advantage and stocked up on a few goodies.  It is also worth pointing out that the price for the meal was very reasonable indeed.  This I found very pleasing as growing up in a poor neighborhood with not much money as a kid
column13: fish & chips was always a cheap meal  (hence the phrase 'cheap as chips').  Perhaps Americans won't find the real British fish & chips to their taste and that's okay but if you really do want to experience the real thing then this is the place to go.  Whenever my wife and I travel down to Phoenix (about every six weeks) we are going to make it a priority to have our lunch at the Codfather.  I would like to say a sincere 'well done' to the proprietors for a great experience and creating a genuine bit of Britain here in the US.        Happy eating
column14: Roy,

column1: 58P3oSd8P2QNzHrQmRqQZw,"The Codfather was one of those places I wasn't expecting too much from and got way more than I expected. I've now ate almost everything on the menu in some form or another and I have never been underwhelmed with anything I have gotten. They have a great beer selection and a fantastic selection of fried appetizers.   The fish and chips are definitely the flagship here but don't sleep on their more traditional stuff. The pies are great here and bangers and mash and all of the different \versions\"" of it on the menu are all fantastic. If I had to recommend my favorite dishes to a newcomer here other than the obvious fish and chips platter the \""banger
column2: bubble & squeek
column3: and beans\"" and the \""beef and kidney pie\"" are both my favorites the deep fried sausage is also one of those things where it's so good you don't care about the heart attack it's going to for sure give you.  Pros: I have ate here at least 15 times trying most if not everything on the menu and I have never had anything bad or even so-so. Everything has been steller. As long as you understand you are eating at a fish n chip/fried food joint and not a fancy seafood resteraunt you won't be dissapointed. They also have a pretty great beer selection on tap.  Cons: Now even though I can promise you I have never ate something here that wasn't good if I seriously had to nit pick a con here it would have to be pricing. I feel like EVERY dish excluding the English breakfast I pay 1 dollar too much for. Just comparing it to similar resteraunts serving similar things this place is a little pricier than most. It's not so overpriced that it should stop you from eating here but it does prevent me from say
column4: eating there regularly
column5: even though the food deserves it. They also seem to have a difficult time keeping the beer they have on tap stocked regularly. Every time I sit at the bar at least one beer on tap is out. Meh. Not a big deal but just an observation.  All in all \""The Codfather\"" is one of those places that you not only have to try but will undoubtedly make you want to come back again and again. The only reason it doesn't have the 5 star is that I can't walk in there and have a beer and meal and walk out spending less than 30 dollars after the tip. A little more than I expect when going to a place like that. But WOW they are seriously consistently great with everything they have on that menu! Highly recommended.""",

column1: 58P3oSd8P2QNzHrQmRqQZw,This place is awesome!  It is a little pricey
column2: but sometimes they have an all-you-can-eat fish and chips special for about $10 which is totally worth it.  The food is authentic
column3: I haven't had fish and chips this good anywhere else in Phoenix (especially not at Pete's) the chips are cut thick
column4: the fish is fresh and tastes hand battered
column5: the fillets are whole. Plenty of tartar sauce and malt vinegar too.  If you're into beer
column6: the place has a great selection of Euro brews. There's Soccer on the TVs
column7: they sell all kinds of awesome Irish and Scottish and British foods
column8: and they have some of the wildest flavors of Potato Crisps from England also.  The place is absolutely packed on Fridays
column9: so expect a wait. They also close a bit early
column10: like around 8pm typically. So plan your trip. It's worth the trouble.,

column2: Moved to the San Francisco Bay Area
column3: visited the UK  and later lived on Maui

column5: and fries deep fried to perfection.  If you are looking for this classic dish
column6: you will not find a better place than the Codfather. GIANT piece of fried fish and it was delicious. Crispy
column7: soft
column8: juicy
column9: flavourful
column10: perfect with a little vinegar. Amazingly delicious. the chips were golden
column11: fluffy
column12: crispy on the outside but not so much that they can't absorb a generous amount of malt vinegar. For the price
column13: could you really ask for more  My wife & I ordered the cod
column14: which was a HUGE portion and a side of large chips.  The cod was breaded and cooked to a perfectly crispy and crunchy consistency
column15: while still maintaining the moist fish.     FOOD: I ordered the cod
column16: which was a HUGE portion and a side of large chips.  The cod was breaded and cooked to a perfectly crispy and crunchy consistency
column17: while still maintaining the moist fish. I can say that the fish was fresh and the oil that it was cooked in was clean. The fish was fresh as it didn't taste fishy. The fries were lightly fried and it didn't taste too oily which was a good thing. The The chips were delicious ! PRICE: For the price
column18: could you really ask for more.CONCLUSION:  Grab that malt vinegar and pour it on
column19: because this fish and chip stop is the one to enjoy.,

column1: 58P3oSd8P2QNzHrQmRqQZw,"My Wife and I went yesterday around 11:45 a.m. for lunch with high expectations... That was our first error... The second was ordering food... As a teenager many many years ago I worked at a place called Bit Of England Fish and Chips in Tarzana Ca. Well the best thing eaten yesterday were the Malt Vinegar Onions... They were great
column2: but that's where the greatness ENDS... We ordered the Onion Rings and my wife said
column3: \Do you taste any onion? I know it was there but tasteless. The batter was light. Then we ordered a Large order of Cod And Catfish... The Chips(fries) were good. The Fish had a taste
column4: unfortunately it was a taste of grease and no fish taste. The Catfish was a little better than the Cod. There was a greasy film left in my mouth that was a lingering memory. Still no one beats Pier 83 or George and the Dragon...service was good
column5: but don't understand why they incur labor cost of a wait staff when you should be able to walk up to a counter and order.. Another 15%-18% wasted... If service is decent or good we never penalize the wait staff for lousy food
column6: they didn't cook it...""",

column1: 58P3oSd8P2QNzHrQmRqQZw,"Food was a 4 Decor was a 3 Music on Tuesday 4.5  Hey
column2: I stopped by this authentic British Fish N Chips joint last night and was surprised that I could not find a spot near the restaurant  entrance to park at the parking lot was full and this was a small strip center on Bell road with retail and service stores that were all closed. The place was relatively full for a Tuesday night at 7PM...more on that.  Since I felt like having authentic \Fish and Chips\"" the very nice lady behind the counter says \""What kind of fish\""? They have traditional Cod and Halibut and Salmon and Corvina. Plus Shrimp and Scallops and a lot more.Well in as much as I have been trying to minimize the fried foods in my life
column3: I felt that I was down a Quart of Oil....so what the heck. Hey I just ran the 1/2 marathon last week
column4: so go for it.   Had a piece of cod and the scallops as well and an order of onion rings. I must say
column5: I was impressed with the fish and scallops. Very crispy cod and a nice portion as well. I had 10 scallops ($6.00) which are scallops and nothing else but for $6.00. Pretty good.  Was not impressed with the miniscule serving of tartar sauce and it's $.25 extra per serving (about a tablespoon). Well I must admit I like a little fish with my Tartar sauce. Don't get me wrong
column6: I was impressed with the flavor of the food. I guess I just had too much oil. Maybe that's why I did not like the onion rings as much. They were good but by now
column7: I reached my limit of oil.Again
column8: fish is expensive and these portions were very nice.  Here's the biggest surprise and would have given The Codfather another 1/2 star if Yelp allowed half stars which I guess they don't. It's open mike Tuesday and there was a pretty decent band playing. 4 pieces
column9: Banjo
column10: bass
column11: 2 guitars. After a few sets
column12: a duet with a gal and guitar and a guy playing a mandolin were next. Pretty good
column13: gave the place a nice buzz
column14: people were listening and it was an added bonus to my Tuesday meal.   Finally....Thursday night these Brits open it up to an Irish Band (Raic) and I'm going to go...for some food and music. A very nice surprise in N. Phoenix. They might get to 4 stars soon.   all the best""",

column1: 58P3oSd8P2QNzHrQmRqQZw,The Codfather is my new neighborhood spot. I love this little place
column2: and for many good reasons.  I'm huge on service
column3: and am not afraid to indulge in food and beverage alone and therefore

column1: 58P3oSd8P2QNzHrQmRqQZw,"I have to start with an old UK Joke.   \How did you find the steak and kidney pie? \""     \""I moved a chip...    The plusses. They have hard cider:) The chips are not those evil stringy jokes  that  pass for fast food places \""or the  crisp and crunchy variants they are pretty  close to decent home made chips  but  having grown up in the uk and eating this for  3-4 years during college   ( and they wonder why Scots have the most heart disease  outside of  New Orleans:))   this is  not just like home.       This is still very much  fish and chips at the \""sit down\""   rather than take out level. E.g   They are adequate but  didn't kick me back  nostalgia wise and  so far in the US I've not found decent ( aka bad:)  UK food that didn't come out of one or two suppliers  in the states and was lovingly heated to the same directions.   The steak and kidney pie
column2: holy heck it was lame. I'm eating offal here so you have to give me some credit for knowing when the piss is being taken.   It's not an fully enclosed pie like they would serve in the UK which is finger food meant to be consumed on the move which doesn't describe this 80% crust to filling ratio at all.  This needs a fork
column3: and  not that big a one cos three  trawls of the pieplate was all I  got out of it.  So far the only place that has gotten remotely  close to UK pastry  is the  Cornish pastie co in Tempe. Seriously this alone took it from 3 to 2 stars.If it cost $2 more but actually contained the advertised ingredients in identifiable lumps I'd be happier as it is less insulting  in the long run.   Nearly everyone else fakes it  and cooks a filling
column4: then crust and marries them later  to heat. Having ketchup in packets is just bloody annoying

column1: lp-J_cO5owuMzGJqdn3PNg,Went here to try something new and had a bad experience but the pizza was great. They were all out of basil too which was an ingredient on two of the three pizzas that I ordered. Add to that the occasional verbal assault by the homeless asking for money while you dine outside and the experience is more than forgettable ... I hope.""",

column1: lp-J_cO5owuMzGJqdn3PNg,"I think it only fair to lay out some background information before writing this review:  First
column2: I don't get the concept of \thin crust\"" pizzas and I never will.  I wasn't impressed with them when Dominoes came up with the concept some 30 years ago and I'm still not.  Back in New York
column3: a thin-crust pizza wasn't firm like a cracker and
column4: thus
column5: didn't hold up firmly when you put things on it.  It was doughy.  I admit to being a carboholic and the thicker the crust
column6: the better (Go Sicilian!).  I call thin crust pizza \""Jewish Pizza\""
column7: because it reminds me of putting toppings on top of a piece of matzoh (except matzoh's a bit thicker and doesn't fall apart like ashes if you grab it too hard).  MOD Pizza's concept is simple:  come in and pick one of their pre-selected topping pizzas or make your own.  In that respect
column8: not too different from Papa Murphy's.  The resemblance ends there.  Whereas my partner's white sauce pizza had lots of sauce on it
column9: the guy making mine decided to \""spread\"" the sauce around with the ladle
column10: thus making it thin (i.e.
column11: non existent).  My fault:  I could have said something.  Likewise
column12: the woman making my friend's pizza was generous with toppings
column13: my guy acted like they were making him pay for every topping he sprinkled on my pizza.  The pizza is good
column14: especially if you're a fan of the as-solid-as-air crust of thin pizzas.  Ambiance is another matter.  There's both indoor and outdoor seating in this strip mall.  Like many such outdoor locales in Phoenix
column15: this one adjoins a parking lot with a busy street across the way.  Since the weather was beautiful today
column16: we decided to sit outdoors
column17: especially as music was playing loudly inside.  Unfortunately
column18: whether they can't or don't want to
column19: the music cannot be shut off outside and it's not played softly.  To me
column20: music is very subjective
column21: just like art
column22: and if you're listening to something you don't like
column23: it doesn't enhance the meal
column24: it ruins it.  Take a guess by my tone which category I fall into!  Finally
column25: I have to say
column26: that I'm NOT a cheap person
column27: I'm frugal.  A cheap person won't part with his/her money unless upon pain of death
column28: a frugal person isn't loose with his/her money either
column29: but has no problem paying for something when it's worth it.  I'm not arrogant or idiotic enough to believe that labor costs and convenience shouldn't be built into a price.  $7.49 + tax for a personal pizza on crispy loose leaf paper is not a bad deal.  But for $2.99
column30: I can go to Safeway

column1: lp-J_cO5owuMzGJqdn3PNg,"I was very excited to finally see a decent pizza place in this area!  The \design your own\"" pizza craze is hot in Phoenix and this chain
column2: although being the third entry in the field
column3: are gonna make a race of it.  You get an 11 inch pizza for only $7.47 with as many or few toppings of your choice for one low price!  Or
column4: if you prefer just a cheese pizza
column5: ask for the \""maddy\"" for only $5.97.  They even have a \""mini\"" size for those with smaller appetites.  After selecting the size of your crust (and yes
column6: they do have gluten-free available)
column7: you have your option of several toppings
column8: including a rich tomato sauce
column9: BBQ
column10: and others.  As much as I wanted to stay traditional
column11: the pesto sauce was calling my name (and I highly recommend it).  Your choice of toppings are extensive
column12: and of high quality from the fresh meat to the colorful and vibrant vegetables.  Even the fresh herbs appeared to be freshly chopped.  In addition to the normal toppings
column13: this place has a few I have not see elsewhere
column14: like Asiago cheese
column15: pepperoncini
column16: fresh chopped rosemary and even a balsamic fig glaze to top it off.  The pizzas are cooked in a brick oven (not a conveyor belt like one of the other places) and come out fresh
column17: hot and crisp in just a couple of minutes.  I made short work of the my Pesto and Veggie pizza
column18: and will be back to expand my creativity and satisfy my hunger very soon....  They also have \""design your own\"" salads
column19: garlic strips
column20: and for desserts
column21: cinnamon strips and sweet tarts.  Although you may have to skip the dessert if you decide to indulge yourself with one of their very tasty milkshakes.  One more thing before I go.  I have to mention the to-go boxes that are actually two separate pieces
column22: which I found a bit odd at first
column23: until I realized it was a clever and convenient way to share (if you can).  P.S. Extra kudos for having Angry Orchard Cider!""",

column1: lp-J_cO5owuMzGJqdn3PNg,From the moment I walked in
column2: their set-up looked a lot like Subway subs (adding toppings down the line as you please). So for that reason
column3: I wasn't expecting high hopes on quality
column4: taste
column5: or both.   After my first order today
column6: pizza is really delicious. You can either order custom pizzas that are already pre-made with Mod suggestions listed on the side wall with ingredients
column7: or you can make yours custom right there on the spot. All the decisions and the wait time for the pizza to cook
column8: took about 10min. They also have glass bottles of Fanta & Coca-Cola (real Mexican style) which I loved! All pizzas are thin crust
column9: and I really wish I would have ordered a mini size. The next level up is the Mod size
column10: and I could barely eat 3 out of the 4 slices. Keep in mind I'm a 30yr old 200 lbs 6 foot tall guy. I had my pizza with extra red sauce
column11: mozzarella cheese
column12: gorgonzola cheese
column13: chicken
column14: pepperoni
column15: and salami. The price including the glass coca-cola bottle was $10.89. I know with fluctuations
column16: prices are increasing
column17: although I still feel it's a bit much
column18: but again perhaps the Mod size was too big. I almost want to give it 5 stars.,

column1: lp-J_cO5owuMzGJqdn3PNg,MOD Pizza is absolutely incredible!! I am now boycotting all other pizza establishments until they step up their game. I have visited MOD at least ten times since they opened near Metrocenter!! Where else can you get unlimited toppings with your choice of sauces for the same price every time? No coupons needed!! The thin crust cooked inside their magical oven is always right..the toppings are fresh and their sauce options keep me trying something new. The best part about MOD so far is the staff!! It is a good feeling to be served by happy people! They are attentive to their customers and make you feel welcome!! Keep up the great work MOD!! Until we meet again..probably tomorrow  Tim P,
YSOaPUm5EORusVSPB6_Zag,I've gone to Whataburger since I was a kid and not a whole lot has seemed to change. I enjoy their burgers much more then McDonald's
column2: Wendy's and Burger King! I wouldn't say it's my favorite burger place
column3: but it's decent and a reasonable price.,

column1: ikcyah81MTF4ZzOivmPitw,I like this location because they always get my order right and if I park and order they are usually really quick. The drive-through tends to take a little bit longer so I always just park instead. I try to come during their happy hour between 2-4 to get half price drinks. I always order a cherry limeade with easy ice. Most places will throw a ton of ice in even if you ask for easy ice but this place doesn't!,

ikcyah81MTF4ZzOivmPitw,"i wish we had sonic in hawaii! i love this place! and this place is in my boyfriends sisters backyard of her old house! we always have to stop here everyday of our vacation in arizona! even if its \cold\"". cold to me because its always 80 degrees in hawaii! but the slush's are sooo cheap and gooood. Ooh i must stop talking because i'm having withdrawls. :(""",
WjT_DJivd3I98FxDgEZpTQ,The first time I ate the fries
column2: I hated it. But then
column3: I got used to them. Now
column4: they taste really good! I eat at In-N-Out Burger so much. Food is usually healthier. It's relatively cheap. And Service is pretty good if the employees are competent.  I eat pretty healthy and I eat a lot. The best thing about this place is you can eat a lot in a healthy way for cheap. So just protein style hamburger (the custom order where they replace the bread with lettuce). Then just add extra onion
column5: extra tomatoes and extra pickles for free. That's like a salad in itself. And for how much? $2.11 with tax. Not bad.
column6: )  If you really want to pig out
column7: then order the animal style fries. It's not healthy. It has cheese and dressing and whatever they put in there. Or a 4x4 and some fries and shake. It's good. Just not healthy. But I love this place!,

column1: WjT_DJivd3I98FxDgEZpTQ,This was the first time I have ever been to a(n) in and out. Fast friendly service. Reasonable prices. Best burger I have gotten from a non mom and pop shop.  This in and out is by the fiesta mall

column1: WjT_DJivd3I98FxDgEZpTQ,Fresh

Their shakes are really good and hit the spot when it comes to sweetness for me. Usually it's the ice cold Diet Coke that lures me though. The only drawback for me is that they don't have Coke Zero. Coke Zero is my absolute drink of drinks and if it isn't offered

column1: ZlvVCqFKTMK4rBkTQzVBpA,What can I say? I am really impressed by their business

column4: but it was disappointing and I sent my concern off to Jersey Mike's. Within a couple of hours the manager of the location I had this experience called me.  She offered to treat my family to a sub dinner for our trouble. That is obvious commitment to quality service. The subs were fantastic this time. Turns out they were actually having issues with the slicer the day I went.   They will get my business again
column5: their subs are tasty

column1: ZlvVCqFKTMK4rBkTQzVBpA,What can I say?  The sandwiches are incredible!  A friend told me about this chain and it's now my favorite place for a great sub.  Great taste

column1: kcBHEBHnTx9ySJwOdaSgPA,"I was told about this place by some friends from Wisconsin and so decided to stop by when out in AZ recently.  They have an extensive menu and so it took me a few minutes to decide to try their current burger promotion the \pub burger\"" with a side of cheese curds.  I knew I would not be able to eat any of their custard on this trip though.  The burger came in an onion bun
column2: with fried onions
column3: I think blue cheese crumbles and A1 sauce.  It was tasty enough & well cooked
column4: but really all of the flavors seemed to merge into each other - nothing stood out.  The cheese curds were well cooked (not greasy at all)
column5: but were really lacking seasoning (I sound like a judge on Chopped).  Overall it was tasty (and resonably priced) enough that I would stop by again and try out some other items - and try and make it to dessert.""",

column1: kcBHEBHnTx9ySJwOdaSgPA,This culvers in Casa Grande brings some much needed variety to the slim dining choices of our little town. I would go as far to say that this is probably the best burger in Casa Grande....not that it is saying much. The custard is amazing and I LOVE that they have mashed potatoes with gravy. My family has tried a lot of their menu and except for the Walleye
column2: we haven't been disappointed.   The only thing holding this place back is the high cost of the food. Going to Culvers is usually a treat for us and we know that the bill will be higher than most fast food places that we frequent. However
column3: the high quality of the food means that you definitely get what you pay for. I just think that paying 5 or 6 bucks for 4 chicken tenders is kind of nuts.   This location has also become the hangout for every elderly person in Casa Grande...I swear. Drive by the outside fireplace area around 7 or 8 PM on a weeknight and you'll see for yourselves.   BTW Prepare for a dirty look when you ask for Ketchup...they use these fancy schmancy expensive ketchup packets and dole them out sparingly....GRAB A BUNCH....at least that way you get more for your money!!!,

column2: great atmosphere
column3: excellent guest service. Always a good time there

column1: 2s5tyNvj6-eEks5cNFZQMg,Marginally decent chicken strips for marginally decent prices. The chicken was relatively moist but a little tough
column2: the Cane's sauce was definitely not boss in my book (very little flavor other than sweet) and the fries were lukewarm and soggy. As others have mentioned
column3: the drive-thru is engineered poorly with a payment window right as you turn the corner
column4: leading to long lines. If there were other sauce options and better fries it'd be a place re-visiting.,

column1: 2s5tyNvj6-eEks5cNFZQMg,Like it says
column2: Yay! I'm a fan. These are some good chicken strips. The Texas toast is really good too. Plus the fries and never forget the Cane's sauce. The sause works so well with the chicken. I have heard of this place for a while but had never tried it. Mostly because I wasn't near any locations. I llike this one because it is close to school. Works out just right to run over on break and grab some chicken strips. I have only been through the drive thru so I don't know how the inside of the restaurant looks but through the windows it looks very nice and clean. The employees are always very nice and seem like they genuinely like working there. The drive thru moves pretty good. They only have one thing on the menu so it is pretty easy. You just have to decide how many strips you want. Every box comes with fries
column3: Texas toast and of course the yummy sause. You can also get coleslaw in some of the boxes. I have yet to try that. The prices are pretty good too. No more than other fast food places. I am a fan and I will continue to come here on break. The chicken is very tender and juicy. It just falls apart when you bit into it. So good. Winner winner chicken dinner! I had to say it.,

column1: 2s5tyNvj6-eEks5cNFZQMg,This place does one thing good and that is chicken strips!  I do not think they'll mind me saying this.  Prices are very reasonable.  The strips are amazing for fast food!  I've been to their other locations and this store on their second or third day.  Raising Cain's has some impressive quality standards in-place.  Every location I go to I am always served juicy chicken strips and the staff are trained well to assure that you will have excellent customer service.  I'm going on a limb here and am declaring these chicken strips the best fast food has to offer.,

2s5tyNvj6-eEks5cNFZQMg,"Wow ia that drive thru packed after 5 p.m.!  It was way faster for me to just get off of my car and order inside. I got my order extremely fast. We wanted to try it after my brother raved of it being the best. I got the 6 piece chicken fingers

column3: Cole slaw

column5: and cane sauce.  I thought it was a little in the pricey side. I didn't really enjoy the chicken with their sauce. I ate mine with the Louisiana hot sauce they have at the restaurant. If my husband or I are ever in the mood for \chicken fingers\"" we'll just stick to KFC not worth the drive from Buckeye.""",

column2: which ended in him loudly and unapologetically complaining about portion sizes and price. My best bud Polo is a big dude

column4: \""whats that place?\"" he says
column5: \""oh

column9: and a chicken curry for myself. As we waited for our orders a group of elderly folks strolled by
column10: donna summer was playing on the radio

column14: had a quick refresher
