gEAB85-Zcm8Qs5JQPC_PHg,Found this place while waiting for car to get repaired
column2: awesome food
column3: service and prices! Calling their regulars by name.,

column1: gEAB85-Zcm8Qs5JQPC_PHg,Where do I start. The coney dogs are great!  The hot dogs are very good and the chili has great flavor. I did the Coney Special and it included 2 coney dogs
column2: a boat of fries
column3: and a drink for $8.88. Tons of food. Super cheap.   The Better Made Honey BBQ chips rock. They are soooo good. I love them. I looked on the package and they are made in Detroit.   My husband had a Philly cheesesteak pita. It was freshly made and tasted so good. The meat was cooked perfectly and the flavors commingled together very well.   My only complaint is that they didn't have tea. Said they didn't have tea bags. I already purchased a drink and had to go and purchase a bottle of water too.,

column1: gEAB85-Zcm8Qs5JQPC_PHg,"FINALLY ! A huge thank you to David for bringing a real deal Detroit coney to Phoenix. He took the time to explain to this former Detroiter the finer points of his business
column2: the quality meats he uses (from Detroit)
column3: and convey his sincere desire to succeed. This restaurateur earns your business the right way... prompt
column4: friendly
column5: great food
column6: and a clean \shop\""  The spice in the coney sauce is PERFECT ...recommend the Coney Special (you will want a fork). You could hop on a plane and drive to 118 W Lafayette Blvd
column7: close your eyes
column8: and taste the same exact coney dog...  priceless Bonus points for having Faygo and Better-Made chips and a legit Hani - Much success to the owner
column9: earned this repeat customer with one visit.""",

column1: gEAB85-Zcm8Qs5JQPC_PHg,"Drove up from Tucson. Great Coneys and Faygo too! After finishing off the Coney dogs

column3: which is a hot dog bun filled with loose hamburger meat
column4: and topped with chili
column5: mustard and onion. It's a Detroit specialty!  Reasonable prices. Worth the trip.""",

column1: gEAB85-Zcm8Qs5JQPC_PHg,Good food
column2: Detroit loose burger was great
column3: the Detroit Coney Combo was outstanding
column4: fresh cut fries was very good.  Prices were very reasonable.  Granddaughter had the double burger thought it was super.  Owner was very hands on and made the experience even more enjoyable,

column1: gEAB85-Zcm8Qs5JQPC_PHg,Hot dogs are ok.  Not exactly what I would get when in Ann Arbor but still not bad.  Prices are on the high side for a hot dog.   Not sure if I will be back.  This place definitely does a good lunch business though.,

gEAB85-Zcm8Qs5JQPC_PHg,Temporary fix for a Midwest staple. I've been here in Arizona for a little over 5 years . Moving from Detroit I stayed eating at a Coney Island at least one meal of the day. So when I heard of the Detroit coney grill I was very excited
column2: an to find out that they were getting their chilli from one of the best if not oldest coneys in Detroit
column3: made it Mir appealing. When I told my wife that there was a coney in the valley we decided to check it out. When we made if to the location I knew I was in the right place. Several people leaving the place with their Detroit tigers fitted I felt at home for a quick second. The vibe inside was nice
column4: some photos on the wall of certain Michigan team an a few other things Detroit. So now we get to the food which is really the reason that we came. Unlike most of the other people who have given reviews I was somewhat unimpressed by the menu as well as pricing an hours. Understand this
column5: I am Detroit in every way shape an form. I've said on many occasions that if there were a coney out here that was exactly how we have them back home you would have a winner. Although the food is nice here
column6: it's menu is missing so much that would make this a great place to go. I don't want to just go to a spot because its reminds me somewhat of home. And I think that this is what's happening with this place. So many people from Michigan have moved out here to the valley that anytime that you hear of anything from home you want to check it out. Coneys are a 24/7 grill with sooooo much to choose from on the menu you sometimes stand at the counter trying hard to make a decision on what to get. Burgers an coney fries are nice however just a scratch of the surface. And 2 bucks for a faygo is highway robbery
column7: especially when you can go to certain qts or circle k's an get a 20 oz for 1 buck. The guy told us that they charge that much because it cost so much to send them out here. I know some may see this as a raggin rant
column8: however it's not. In order to stand the test of time with a business you have to look at everything your patrons are saying an try to make adjustments. If not that same thing can turn around and bite you. Hopefully this is just a start to a great establishment in the valley. I'll be back to see if anything has changed. #whatupdoe,

column1: gEAB85-Zcm8Qs5JQPC_PHg,Delicious
column2: cheap
column3: friendly.  You obviously don't have to be from Detroit to enjoy it
column4: but if you are
column5: there's definitely a sense of nostalgia.  Highly recommended.,

column1: gEAB85-Zcm8Qs5JQPC_PHg,The guys who run this place are great but the coney itself didn't blow me away. It's pretty small for the price and I actually enjoyed eating the fries more than the dog. Check in on Yelp for a meal discount. I guess i'm more of a $1.50 Costco Polish kind- of-guy.,

column1: gEAB85-Zcm8Qs5JQPC_PHg,I love this place.  From the first visit
column2: I knew this was a joint I would frequent whenever I come to town for work.  In fact
column3: I have my coworker addicted to this place now.  We decided that since this place is so great
column4: it's on the short list of places to go with the company cool kids secret club.    The customer service is great
column5: like really great.  The owner is helladope.  He always has an exuberant greeting
column6: handshake
column7: or hug for me whenever I come in.  The guys behind the counter are always super friendly and helpful.  Didn't know you needed a spoon and ketchup?...don't fret
column8: they knew you did and they'll bring it to you.  The prices are low.  You can fill yourself up to bursting for less than twenty bucks.  There are quite a few things on the menu
column9: but why would you get anything other than the Detroit Coney?  The hot dogs are great.  You know you're eating a good dog when it snaps when you bite into it.  The onions could be a little bit more oniony for me with just a little bit more bite to 'em.  The chili-fries are so so good.  I can feel my arteries clogging with every delicious bite and if I have a fat-girl heart attack on the way out of the door
column10: it'll be worth it.  They also carry a bunch of Faygo
column11: but you need not paint on your ICP face to have any.  I've had a few other things
column12: but it's really all about the hot dogs and fries.,

column1: gEAB85-Zcm8Qs5JQPC_PHg,"What is it that makes this place so special? I had the Combo Coney Dog
column2: that isn't chili dog..  and it did nothing to me. Hot-dogs are substandard food no matter how much you pay for it. And the chili on top was no culinary experience at all. it made my hot-dog bun soggy. It had no great flavor
column3: nor was in special in any fashion.   The service is good though.. just a little too much Disney over the whole \we're so genuine\"". I find it parodying true home pride.. and not in a good way. It looks clean but it is a fast food place
column4: and I am trying to figure out what it is that people like with this place. The food isn't anything special. There is no ambiance to speak of. So what is it? They are nce here
column5: they are. But it becomes a theme park kinda thing. \""We have all this Genuine Detroit kinda hot dogs and stuff\""... Ohyeah
column6: looks and taste like normal hot-dog to me.  (I was leaning to the cheese fries. in my mind it would be fries slightly overdone
column7: a hint of vinegar and topped with some interesting hard cheese flavor. But instead it is same fries w nacho cheese (you know the crap you cannot legally refer to as cheese). I didn't try it. I saw it. So happy i didn't go that route.)  Yes
column8: they sell some stuff like Faygo that is good and all
column9: but all-in-all you pay for a meal that's suppose to reflect something that doesn't really exists. It's a hot dog stand with a gimmick.  A gimmick that I can't even grasp. That is it - and promoting the emperors new clothes is not my thing.   Best part of my meal - overpriced Faygo. I will not suggest to come back here.""",

column1: XA-mMT47rFZNEllPBCYWQQ,If the food weren't so good
column2: this Chipotle would represent my idea of one of the nine circles of Hell.  Enter on the wrong weekday evening during peak dinner hours
column3: and you will feel like you're stuck in the middle of a daycare center.  Little kids run around as if they're in a McDonald's Play Place
column4: but since there is no play area
column5: they're just running around the restaurant.  If you're picking up food at this time
column6: do yourself a huge favor and order it online to-go.  The 27 minute line (I'm not exaggerating
column7: I timed it on my cellphone) is to be expected at 6:30 on a Wednesday night
column8: but the crammed crowd and noise was pretty hard to bare.  Parking is also a regular pain at this shopping center.  I am not a kid hater.  I also understand that these issues are not entirely Chipotle's fault (which is why the place still gets four stars).  It's the parents job to keep their kids in line and it would be a PR nightmare for any company to try to do something about it.  But if you perfer to be in an environment without children running around like it's recess
column9: then you may want to give another location a try.  There's quite a few other Chipotles just a couple of miles away.  The saving grace is my love for Chipotle's food.  It's the one fast-food option my girlfriend and I regularly agree on when we're too lazy to cook and not in the mood to dine out.  Everything is fresh and tasty.  The extra charge for stuff like guacamole is annoying.  But Chipotle delivers great food at a good price
column10: so I'm more than willing to put up with the headaches to get my delicious burrito.,

column1: XA-mMT47rFZNEllPBCYWQQ,Under new management. FRED from Chicago and his apprentice Sam have made some favorable changes to this fast food dine in delicacy.  I have always been a fan of Mexican food. My metabolism is constantly making me crave a massive amount of food.  If you are in the mood for a huge burrito
column2: bowl
column3: or tacos... this is your one stop shop.  Always consistent
column4: fast and inexpensive.  Walking into the restaurant today
column5: something was noticeably different.  Ah
column6: yes it was the positive attitude from the gentleman behind the counter. Friendly
column7: outgoing
column8: smiling and pleasant would best describe his demeanor.  FRED a fellow Midwestern took over this bad boy 1 month ago and certainly has enhanced its flavor.  Have you been to a fast food restaurant before where the gm comes over to your table to see if everything is okay or you need a refill on your drink?  Welcome again back to chipotle.  what a positive experience today and had to yelp about it because this guy has gone the extra mile.  For a massive 2 pound burrito for under 10 bucks and quick..... this is your go to. enjoy.,

column2: moist masa but not too thick or dry. The chicken actually had a bit of heat
column3: but so flavorful. The tacos were amazing just how I remembered them.  Full 5 stars for the owner(?) who asked if I wrote the review that had a missing taco and said they would give me one on the house. Which I didn't feel was necessary
column4: but was so nice. I ended up tipping them for it anyways.  The food here is amazing and miss my local eateries in San Jose
column5: California so much because the flavor of the food is so similar.   Great tacos
column6: cheap prices and I give props to establishments who do take the time to read reviews here.   Thank you Atoyac
column7: I'll definitely be back for more Taco Tuesdays!  P.S. My room mate had never had Mexican food- besides Taco Bell and Chipotle (which you can hardly call Mexican/inspired) but she thoroughly enjoyed this new cuisine and left satisfied!,

column1: C9JmR3jZfGnW6xbPMCT3aQ,Before the fateful day in late March when Tacos Atoyac shut down
column2: I lamented mostly the loss of their excellent fish tacos. Some of their other tacos weren't the best I've had
column3: but they had the best fish tacos anywhere. So when I heard they had opened back up
column4: of course I was excited.  My return visit came with some trepidation
column5: of course. I heard Dan was no longer involved
column6: and Dan was part of the experience.  The food should be the same
column7: right? Same menu
column8: same prices.  I got a smattering of what I consider the best offerings the previous incarnation offered: two fish tacos
column9: a quesadilla with lengua
column10: and the churro.  The quality of the tacos did not decline at all. I could've sworn they used to have more fish in them
column11: however. Was I just imagining things? I don't know
column12: it's hard to quantitatively compare something to a mere fading memory. But the fish tacos are still undoubtedly good.  The quesadillas
column13: however
column14: provided considerably more insight. Atoyac v1 quesadillas were packed with meat and cheese - so much that if you get the lengua quesadillas
column15: you have a substantial pool of (delicious) grease sitting at the bottom of the tray. These things were so overflowing that it was sometimes hard to pick them up without the meat falling out.  Now? Barely any cheese OR meat. The meat was actually scattered around the quesadilla
column16: with areas completely devoid of meat! And the cheese was spread extremely thin compared to the old quesadillas.  It's clear that what happened here is what is known as size inflation (as opposed to price inflation).  They raise the price by lowering the portions. And that just makes for worse food - give me the same food at a higher price
column17: if you must.  Apart from the disappointing cheapening of the product
column18: this place also lacks any charm at all without Dan's presence. And that goes a long way
column19: too.,

column1: C9JmR3jZfGnW6xbPMCT3aQ,Before the fateful day in late March when Tacos Atoyac shut down
column2: I lamented mostly the loss of their excellent fish tacos. Some of their other tacos weren't the best I've had
column3: but they had the best fish tacos anywhere. So when I heard they had opened back up
column4: of course I was excited.  My return visit came with some trepidation
column5: of course. I heard Dan was no longer involved
column6: and Dan was part of the experience.  The food should be the same
column7: right? Same menu
column8: same prices.  I got a smattering of what I consider the best offerings the previous incarnation offered: two fish tacos
column9: a quesadilla with lengua
column10: and the churro.  The quality of the tacos did not decline at all. I could've sworn they used to have more fish in them
column11: however. Was I just imagining things? I don't know
column12: it's hard to quantitatively compare something to a mere fading memory. But the fish tacos are still undoubtedly good.  The quesadillas
column13: however
column14: provided considerably more insight. Atoyac v1 quesadillas were packed with meat and cheese - so much that if you get the lengua quesadillas
column15: you have a substantial pool of (delicious) grease sitting at the bottom of the tray. These things were so overflowing that it was sometimes hard to pick them up without the meat falling out.  Now? Barely any cheese OR meat. The meat was actually scattered around the quesadilla
column16: with areas completely devoid of meat! And the cheese was spread extremely thin compared to the old quesadillas.  It's clear that what happened here is what is known as size inflation (as opposed to price inflation).  They raise the price by lowering the portions. And that just makes for worse food - give me the same food at a higher price
column17: if you must.  Apart from the disappointing cheapening of the product
column18: this place also lacks any charm at all without Dan's presence. And that goes a long way
column19: too.,

column1: C9JmR3jZfGnW6xbPMCT3aQ,It's cheap
column2: it's delicious
column3: and it's delicious. Also
column4: it's delicious. I can't really elaborate beyond these points
column5: but if you're a Phoenix native
column6: you must go here for tacos. Simply must.  Also
column7: try the memelitas! :D,

column1: C9JmR3jZfGnW6xbPMCT3aQ,Blink and you'll miss this spot
column2: tucked next to a gas station just before the northeast corner of 19th Avenue and Glendale
column3: which has become our go-to for good tacos in the Valley.  The exterior might look a bit intimidating
column4: and the interior doesn't leave much to be said for atmosphere
column5: but all you need are their extremely well-priced tacos to feel like this place could be your second home.  Carne asada is some of the best in the valley
column6: fish tacos are phenomenal
column7: and pastor and lengua were not disappointing.  The tortillas are the perfect weight and texture with just enough corn flavor.  We also tried the molote
column8: a masa fritter with potato and chorizo
column9: which was a crispy nugget of Mexican comfort food reminiscent of mashed potatoes if mashed potatoes got a stylish makeover that involved spice
column10: black beans
column11: and queso fresco wrapped in fried
column12: corn-y goodness.  Service might be lacking
column13: but for less than $15 to feed a hungry couple
column14: you really can't complain.,

column1: C9JmR3jZfGnW6xbPMCT3aQ,"No hay ninguna cosa en todo M_xico que se llama \perro caliente.\""  Especialmente en el estado de Oaxaca.  En que exactamente estn pensando ustedes?  My previous review still stands.  Thank God Dan is gone.    All the other reviewers . . . don't gush about things of which you have no personal knowledge or experience.  Like when I go into pizza joints en Michoacn o Guerrero and the Mexican nationals tell me that this is the \""best pizza in the world\"" and it is \""just like NY or Chicago.\""  Uh
column2: no it isn't
column3: and you don't have room to judge or gush.  And if you don't understand what I wrote above
column4: you REALLY don't have room to judge . . . either me
column5: or the menu
column6: or the taste/quality of the food.  Best of luck to the new owners/management (?) but to anyone who hasn't been here . . . don't believe the Yelp hype
column7: because that is all it is . . . hype from people who think they know better but really don't.  If you really want good tacos (that will actually fill you up at a decent price) go to one of the many Los Favoritos locations across the valley.""",

column1: 2voFtcyopB3jJHepouMWDQ,Get in my belly!!!  I could eat this everyday and not get tired of it!  We had some newbies in the group and the staff was extremely friendly in explaining all of the toppings that go on top of the burgers.   We had 5 burgers
column2: 4 fries
column3: and a shake
column4: all for $21! Delicious and cheap? That is my kinda place!  The place is also spotless and I like that try make their fries from scratch. Enjoy!,

column1: 2voFtcyopB3jJHepouMWDQ,It's fast food chain done right - high quality - they only locate stores that they can reach from their own distribution centers
column2: always fresh food consistent experience - these places will always be clean
column3: they will have cheerful staff
column4: you know what's on the menu and there aren't any surprises. good prices - a hamburger
column5: fries and a soda for under $6 - with taxes -  how often can you say that? the menu is simple in terms of the basics of what is offered but highly creative in terms of how you can get it served (animal style fries - who else does that?) it's an experience
column6: it's the kind of place you probably won't go to every day but when you do
column7: you know that you'll get a great burger at a good enough price that you don't have to skip the fries.,

column1: 2voFtcyopB3jJHepouMWDQ,I like these burgers
column2: its cheap
column3: its relatively fast even when busy
column4: and I like that I like these burgers even though it seems like I enjoy the huge piece of tomato and lettuce more than the meat.,

column1: #NAME?,Firehouse Serves up good subs and salads.   First
column2: I have to say the service at Firehouse Subs is great!  The staff welcomes you when you walk through the door.  On my first visit to Firehouse Subs (some time ago).  Upon arriving we were met by an employee handing out menus.  My co-worker and I were asked if it  was our first visit to Firehouse Subs and we said yes. The emoloyee went over the menu and recommended we try the smokehouse beef and cheddar brisket.  The sub was delicious.  After leaving we couldn't stop talking about how good the sub was. In fact we went right back to firehouse subs a few days later.   So if your hungry for a good sub at a great price
column3: head over to firehouse.,

column1: #NAME?,Mike C. joined me to whip into this place and try it today.  OMG what a great sandwich!  I went with a make-it-a-large Pastrami.  It was about a foot long & came loaded with pastrami
column2: mayo
column3: mustard
column4: lettuce
column5: tomato
column6: onion & a dill spear on the side
column7: on a very fresh
column8: delicious honey wheat roll.  The staff was friendly
column9: the place completely comfortable and I have just never had a better pastrami!  It was priced right too at $7.89 and I can't wait to return to a Firehouse & start biting my way through the rest of the subs on their menu.  It was special!     :-)),

column1: #NAME?,Really good sub and not bad on price.  So far
column2: I like this place more than Jersey Mike and Jimmy Johns
column3: the sandwich was good
column4: lightly toasted
column5: soft bread and yummy.    I'll be back soon...,

column1: #NAME?,Had a firehouse hero sandwich and it was quite delicious.  It was a very flavorful sandwich
column2: the prices were reasonable
column3: and the people there are friendly.,

column1: #NAME?,"So I was looking for a SUB on a Saturday for lunch
column2: and I remember seeing Firehouse Subs because it was by the Sprouts grocery store that I go to.   I went to the website
column3: and I decided to order online. I am glad I did because for some reason the Subs take  about 12-15 min to make. I understand they steam the meat
column4: but still.  I thought that the online ordering process was a pretty cool feature. It had a lot of options to customize my sandwich. It definitely got me ready to have a SUB feast at Firehouse.  After checking out and spending almost $13 for a Large  (Steamer) SUB
column5: and a sandwich plus a cookie. I was finally ready to pick up my order.  I decided to dine in to get the full experience. My order was ready when I got there
column6: I got my soda
column7: and used the Soda fountain to customize my soda which was cool.   The SUB was mediocre at best. Imagine a sub like Quiznos or Subway
column8: but they \steam the meat.\""  That does not necessarily make it better though. They steam the meat so much that the meat was actually soggy
column9: and the bread was meh. The cookie was a basic cookie
column10: nothing special. The best part of the meal was actually the soda.  I would not recommend this place unless you want to pay high prices for a typical non gourmet franchise SUB.  The place looks and feels like Quiznos on roids
column11: and with 5 people behind the counter it shouldn't take this long to make a SUB on average. I think that if you compare this to other sub franchises that it has an edge with all the cool hot sauces to choose from
column12: and the Soda fountain that is not like anything else I have seen in a store like this
column13: but the prices
column14: wait times
column15: and mediocre SUBS hold this place back.""",

column1: #NAME?,"Hey
column2: did you know this place was started by firemen? Well
column3: if you didn't
column4: you're an idiot
column5: because it's plastered all over nearly everything.  My sandwich was decent. It wasn't horrible
column6: but it wasn't good. Before I went
column7: I wondered what their gimmick would be. Besides the firefighter thing
column8: I mean. It turns out their gimmick is steaming their sandwich meat.  Now
column9: I'm no expert
column10: but in my experience with culinary parlance
column11: \steaming\"" ranks somewhere below \""slow-roasted\""
column12: \""braised\""
column13: or \""thinly-sliced\"" and somewhere slightly above \""microwaved\"". I'm open-minded
column14: though. I'd try this uniquely steamed meat. It turns out
column15: I COULD tell the difference. The difference was the meat was warm and wet
column16: almost like it had absorbed a bunch of vaporized air.  What makes Firehouse Subs stand out is their bread
column17: which was really
column18: really good. It was better than Jimmy John's bread
column19: in fact. But between the steaming
column20: the onslaught of fire-fighting paraphernalia
column21: the longer wait
column22: and the higher cost at Firehouse Subs
column23: I'll take Jimmy John's every time. And it's only slightly farther away. I'm down with supporting heroes
column24: but I'd also like to eat reasonably-priced
column25: un-steamed sandwiches on occasion.""",

column1: #NAME?,I simply don't understand some of these reviews below. People are knocking the place because they steam their meat instead roasting/braising it? C'mon. So you can't handle something different or what?  So for this review
column2: I'm comparing it to Subway and Quiznos.  First off
column3: Subway and Quiznos build the sub right there in front of you. At Firehouse
column4: this is not so much the case - you order at the register and then the workers prepare it. For this reason
column5: your sub will take slightly longer to make than either of those places and this is mainly because of how they cook the meat.  Now to the complainers saying that the meat is soggy or whatever
column6: I've never had this experience. And
column7: besides that
column8: not all subs are cooked the same at Firehouse. Maybe before discarding the place
column9: try more of the menu? That is just me though! I've tried many of the subs - Firehouse Meatball
column10: New York Steamer
column11: Italian
column12: Club on a Sub
column13: and the Smokehouse Beef & Cheddar Brisket. My favorites
column14: in order
column15: are Italian
column16: Steamer
column17: and Beef & Cheddar. On a slightly odd note
column18: the Italian makes *great* leftovers if you can't finish it.  Nobody really seems to have mentioned this... but the soda machine is freaking awesome. I don't know how many flavors it has
column19: but it is pretty much the craziest thing you will ever see. It has a touch screen where you scroll through and select your flavor. And when I say select your flavor I mean if you want a Lemonade.... do you want it to be lemonade
column20: raspberry lemonade
column21: lime lemonade
column22: or strawberry lemonade. It is nearly the same for every beverage selection you make.  I definitely prefer Firehouse over Subway or Quiznos. Sure
column23: they may be a little more pricey
column24: but I still like it. I will have to check out Jimmy John's
column25: which everyone seems to rave about to see what all the fuss is about and round out my review for all 4 places.,

column1: #NAME?,I want to like this place
column2: I really do
column3: but today's New York Steamer was probably a Top 10 disappointing sandwich of my life. Soggy
column4: lifeless
column5: unimaginative
column6: and overpriced.   I'd been to Firehouse one previous time
column7: and the meatball was better. Far from spectacular
column8: but much more satisfying than the corned beef/pastrami number I ordered during Visit #2. It was steamed meat
column9: cheese and mayo on an old-tasting white hoagie. No veggies
column10: no color
column11: no texture
column12: no good.  The Firehouse concept and story are cool. The employees are nice. The fountain drink vending machine is second to none. And I enjoy being able to watch college hoops while my sandwich gets steamed to death. But these pros cannot save an underwhelming experience that cost me $9. Subway's $5 Cold Cut Combo would have been a better investment.,

column1: #NAME?,"I really really wanted to give this place a higher star due to the \established by firefighters\"" idea
column2: but I think after it has been opened for a few weeks
column3: the kinks that the other reviewers have mentioned should have thus been addressed and ironed out by now.     These small franchise businesses must up their game in service and quality if they want to survive in this down economy
column4: there is no excuses for below average customer service especially for a brand new food joint trying to BUILD business.      I purposely timed my visit to go after the dinner rush
column5: ample time before closing time.  Before I ordered online
column6: I had driven past the food joint and looked in to make sure that there were no lines or customers waiting
column7: as the common complaint was the long wait time for the sandwiches to be made.     Well
column8: despite my on-line order and the payment made online via credit card (there was no option to pay at pick up if you order online)
column9: when I arrived punctually at the designated time for pick up
column10: the workers looked confused at the confirmation number I handed to them for pick up.  Then
column11: they said:  do you want to pay here at the register
column12: um
column13: look at the receipt
column14: it said credit card payment made online.  Then
column15: someone notified the kid who appeared to be the night manager was notified that the online order was \""missed\""  but he didn't even come out to say anything
column16: he just sat counting bills from the cash register.     I waited.  And waited.  And waited.  Mind you
column17: there were no customers in line ahead or behind me in the whole joint.  After 15 minutes
column18: the sandwich was finally ready.  And the kid making the sandwich said
column19: \""oh
column20: you want it for carryout?  Really?  But I already made it for eat in
column21: darn\"" and then he wrapped the sub in paper.     Hello
column22: are you serious?!  Then one worker said:  \""sorry
column23: we didn't check the fax machine for orders\"".  Ok
column24: then
column25: don't have On-line orders
column26: defeats the purpose
column27: doesn't it?     Food:  And the sub
column28: the \""hot\"" Italian was supposed to be steamed and warm
column29: um
column30: it was sickly lukewarm.  And tasted like the Italian COLD CUT sandwich from Subway.  Yah
column31: it was THAT cold.  The cheese was barely visible as it obviously was so thin it evaporated away.  The only thing I liked about my  Cold-Cut-Supposedly-Hot-Italian Sub was the french bread---The ones at Subway have a weird aftertaste.       I was confused
column32: what sub place did the others eat at????   Sorry
column33: if I'm going to shell out 12 bucks for a sub
column34: chips and drink
column35: I'm going to a deli or to a Subway
column36: where at least I can get a GIANT sub for that price.  While I love FireFighters
column37: my support is going to go via direct donations
column38: Firefighters are all about quality and service.   This place doesn't do our heroes justice.    You are better off going to your local Subway for a Cheap no frills sandwich.""",

column1: 6SWknDhTfrw3NyywMCyZJg,Reasonably Priced Food and Generous Portions.  Seor Taco is a favorite of a friend of mine who has two children ages 9 and 12.  Seor Taco might not be one of my favorite eating establishments but the food at Seor Taco is reasonably priced and the serving sizes are very generous.   Seor Taco has a  small condiment bar. I really enjoy the salsa bar with all the different types of salsa's and hot carrots.  The  burrito  I ordered was good and as I mentioned
column2: a very generous  serving size
column3: large enough to take some home.   Seor Taco offers a variety of entr_es to order from and the customer service is second to none.  No pretense just come in
column4: order
column5: sit down and enjoy.,

column1: 6SWknDhTfrw3NyywMCyZJg,I'm working out at Litchfield Park this month so I finally had a chance to try Senior Taco--a place that always seems packed at their Fountain Hills location the times I am up there.   This is sort of a Filiberto's-style place. It is fast food
column2: it has a similar menu. The prices are similar. However
column3: the food was quite different.   I tried three things
column4: trying some of each and bringing some back to the office with me. First
column5: the carne asada torta. I would say this is the most similar in flavor to Filibertos. Not bad
column6: but not super great. It would have benefited from more meat and less guacamole. I also had a shredded beef
column7: hard-shell taco. This was quite a bit different than Filiberto's and
column8: in my opinion
column9: better. They did not fry it as much
column10: and it had a lot more cheese than I usually get at Filibertos. I also had the carne asada soft taco. The size was large and it was very good. Nothing here is super great
column11: but the tacos were especially yummy.   Service
column12: cleanliness and all of the rest were average or above for a fast food restaurant.   I give it 3.5 stars--leaning toward four due to the size of the dishes for the price.,

column1: 6SWknDhTfrw3NyywMCyZJg,Every Friday night this is what we get at home!! HUGE California burrito for me and I LOVE IT!! Homemade tortillas
column2: lots of food for an excellent price. I need my Senor Taco fix every week! YUM!! Great prices
column3: lots of food... Mmmmm... I'm craving it now!,

column1: 6SWknDhTfrw3NyywMCyZJg,I'll start this by saying I have been here on 4 separate occasions and every time I just get tacos.  No frills
column2: no beans
column3: rice
column4: chips
column5: etc.  I see those as pretty much just filler and I'd rather not.  So this is about their tacos... that being said I'd like to try their breakfast burrito sometime since its received such good reviews.   I have tried their carne asada
column6: pollo
column7: and fish tacos.  So far
column8: my favorites are the steak and fish.  They are quite good
column9: but I wouldn't say they're amazing.  They come double wrapped in corn tortillas (which I love) and a rather large helping of meat per taco.  I usually pound tacos like its my job but 2 is plenty for me here.  To me
column10: on of the keys to a great taco is the cilantro
column11: so I ask for extra and they heap it on!  The meat is pretty good
column12: but I can see how some would call it bland.  It would be great if they spiced it on the grill.  The fish tacos are beer battered
column13: but I have a feeling they are frozen.  So whatever
column14: its a pretty good place for lunch
column15: but I don't really want to try anything else on the menu as it looks pretty dang cheap.  Oh
column16: and they do have a military discount
column17: which is always a plus for me.  So
column18: there you have it:  Good
column19: but not great.  I've heard Don Pancho is the place to try.  Looking forward to my first taco there.  (Did I mention I love tacos?),

column1: 6SWknDhTfrw3NyywMCyZJg,"3.5 stars.... maybe 4  Forget about any of the other fast food Mexican food joints.  The \Ricos\""
column2: \""Bertos\""...  Taco Bell... etc.   This place produces really good fast food/ Mexican food. The beans are great!  The rice isn't bad and the burritos are huge!    We've eaten there twice and the first time around everything was a hit. No issues with the food or the service.  The second time around... the food was still pretty good. The grilled chicken nachos were pretty greasy. the chicken... although flavorful was fatty and this set the tone for the rest of the meal.  Wasn't horrible.. just could have been better.    Do drop in and give this place a try. It isn't expensive... and you better bring an appetite....as mentioned... the portions are huge.   We will go back. Hatch""",

column1: 6SWknDhTfrw3NyywMCyZJg,Ordered take out from this place a few days ago. I had the beef enchilada
column2: beef taco with rice and beans. My husband had the shrimp enchiladas with rice and beans. The beef enchilada meat was seasoned perfectly as were the refried beans. The beef taco meat however didnt seem to have any seasoning. The meat was good but just no flavor really. I would assume they would use the same seasoned shredded beef for the taco that they used on the enchilada but I guess not. Either way the food was very fresh and flavorful minus the beef in my taco. Prices were good for the amount of food you get. Service was a bit bla
column3: but I was ordering take out anyways. Will definetly return to try out the rest of the menu.,

column1: 6SWknDhTfrw3NyywMCyZJg,Quick and inexpensive.    Their fish tacos aren't something to right home about
column2: but I highly recommend trying their shrimp tacos or machaca burro.   Staff is friendly and keeps the restaurant clean.,

column1: 6SWknDhTfrw3NyywMCyZJg,Great food
column2: great price.,

column1: 6SWknDhTfrw3NyywMCyZJg,I have passed this little place by a million times on random trips to the grocery store. Today my husband and I finally popped in for a quick
column2: cheap lunch. While we weren't expecting Frontera Grill
column3: we were appalled with the MOLDY breading on the fish tacos. We brought it to the attention of the gal taking orders
column4: and were offered a replacement (pass) but no refund. We won't be back.,

column1: 6SWknDhTfrw3NyywMCyZJg,I'm going to weigh in here after eating on the other side of town at a more expensive restaurant. We love this place and eat here when we want Mexican.We should have come here tonight!  It is informal

column1: v11wtoKy5sKLAdi8355MKA,"It's mostly a burger joint
column2: similar to Fatburger or Johnny Rockets.  Though they do offer a few other menu choices.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  I had a burger (regular) and fries.  The regular burger was pretty good sized because they do TWO patties.  I like that.  Makes the price a little more palatable.  Burgers are fried on a griddle.  I really prefer my meats to be cooked over actual fire
column3: but that's not an option here.  I went with it anyway.  It is cooked fresh when you order it
column4: and you can get any combination of toppings you want (or none at all
column5: if you prefer).  The burger was pretty good.  Not great
column6: but pretty good.  The fries you can get one of two ways.  Either \plain\"" with just salt (like just about any other place would do) or with Cajun seasoning.  I opted for the latter
column7: and they were really very tasty.  They post on a white board where their potatoes came from that day.  No way to verify if it's real or not
column8: but it was an interesting thing for them to do.  They really do mound the fries up.  I ended up with more than I expected
column9: which was a good thing!  While you wait they have a box of peanuts you can help yourself to.  I grabbed some.  They tasted old.  Not bad.  Just not really fresh.  I've been to other places that do this
column10: and these definitely weren't as fresh as I would expect.  This wouldn't be my first choice for a burger
column11: but they're pretty good.  I'd take Johnny Rockets over them because of their fabulous chocolate shake.  But if JR isn't nearby this place will do in a pinch.""",

column1: v11wtoKy5sKLAdi8355MKA,"I LOVE 5 guys burgers and fries!   Little (meaning 1 patty) bacon cheeseburger is the way to go! Their bacon is so crispy
column2: just the way I like it! I get \everything\"" on it. This even includes grilled mushrooms and grilled onions. They carefully place each topping on and fold it in the foil with perfection.   The fries are good although not my favorite. I like that the post where their potatoes come from up on the white board each day. One regular size order feeds 3 people!!!   Peanuts to munch in while you wait. I love that.   They also have those awesome high-tech touch screen soda machines that are sweeping the nation!   Lacking that fifth star solely because of the price. For this family of 3
column3: we spend no less than $25 in a single visit.""",

column1: v11wtoKy5sKLAdi8355MKA,I was introduced to five guys burgers during one of my many trips up to Chandler Blvd. The burgers come in two sizes
column2: a double and a single. All of the toppings are free and the options are plentiful. The soda machines are the new touch screen type with lots of different flavors. The burgers are always juicy and delicious although I could stand for them to be a little bigger. The real reason why I will continue to return are the fries. OMG these are probably the best fries I've had since I had Thrasher's Fries on the boardwalk of Ocean City MD. If you put ketchup on these fries you are missing the point entirely. Vinegar is provided on the condiment table and takes the fries to the next level. As a word of advice
column3: the small order of fries is more than enough for two people. Save your money and share a small order.   This brings me to the only real negative...the prices. I am aware that if you want a quality burger you will pay for it
column4: but when my wife and I get a burger each
column5: a small fry to share and two drinks and it comes to 20 dollars
column6: something is wrong. I'm never full when I leave and it seems like I should be after spending 20 bucks for lunch.   Definitely worth checking out though if you're a burger/fries fan.,

dec2TzjQ1skgmugHKJyLwQ,"Finally made it around to this In-N-Out location for lunch today.  Of course the place was packed since I arrived at 12:20 but the ordering line moved along at good speed & friendly Anthony took my order.  After ordering

column1: 1_43FZHx3P5D7X-CpIR9WA,The meats are sliced fresh for each sandwich.  The bread is fresh and very flavorful.  The price for the size is great!  I wish they had other sides other than chips.  And I have a card I get punched so every 10th sandwich is free.  I think Jersey Mike's blows Port of Subs out of the water!  Subway is average and very generic.,
1_43FZHx3P5D7X-CpIR9WA,It is good food.  Sometimes a little expensive for what it is but pretty good.,

1_43FZHx3P5D7X-CpIR9WA,Forget about other sub shops - Jersey Mike's is the BEST! They cut the meat and cheese fresh when you order your sub - everything is fresh and delicious every single time I go to Jersey Mike's! I read other reviews about it being expensive - here's the deal - you get what you pay for. Jersey Mike's has quality food and excellent service - well worth paying a little extra for! Tip: Get your sub and then let it sit in the fridge for a few hours - the flavors melt together and become even more amazing :),
1_43FZHx3P5D7X-CpIR9WA,Good bread and meats. Staff was friendly. Little more expensive than subway or mr. Goodcents. But I enjoy it mikes way!,
1_43FZHx3P5D7X-CpIR9WA,Excellent food at a good price. Went in not expecting much but the subs reminded me of philly sub shops back east. Everything was fresh and the store was spotless.,
1_43FZHx3P5D7X-CpIR9WA,Very few chain fast and quick food eateries deserve my attention.  But
column2: Jersey Mike's is the big time exception.  Their sub sandwiches are the best by far
column3: even over mom and pop delis.  My wife and I have eaten at several of their locations throughout the Phoenix area and they are equally excellent.   The fresh sliced meats just seem to be the difference.  The prices are right and the restaurants are kept clean.  Highly recommended.,

column1: 1_43FZHx3P5D7X-CpIR9WA,Good sub but on the expensive side. Also they don't have Fries!! And everytime someone orders a hot sub the entire staff yells HOT STUFF!  It's frickin Annoying! !!!!!!!!!! And serves no purpose! Quit it!,

1_43FZHx3P5D7X-CpIR9WA,JERSEY MIKE'S IS EXPENSIVE FOR A SANDWICH SHOP! Just letting you know that right off the bat if you have yet to go there. Not quite sure what makes their ingredients so much different from the rest that's on planet Earth to warrant their pricing. But I digress. Beyond that the sub I had was very good. I tried the large chicken Parmesan (which will throw you back alittle over $11. That's just for the sandwich. So yeah
column2: the people that work there probably have to work 2 hours to afford a sandwich there.) and I was not disappointed one bit. The only problem I had when I first got there was how to order. I thought it was like Subway so I was expecting them to ask me what I wanted on it while they were making it. But they just made it and wrapped it up without asking me what else I wanted on it. So word to the wise. Make sure u know exactly what you want on it the moment you order.,

column1: 1_43FZHx3P5D7X-CpIR9WA,This location is great
column2: best sub I've had yet. My roommate told me before how friendly the staff was. Not sure if it was the same guy
column3: but very courteous and friendly. It's rare nowadays (in PHX at least) for restaurant employees to care enough to ask you how your day's been and make small talk with people. That always gets a tip out of me! Food is excellent and their roast beef is pink instead of nasty brown. I love that! I would love it even more if they would call it 'roast beast' (Grinch anyone?). Also
column4: their bread is of the crusty variety
column5: not soft like Subway. Sometimes I wonder if other reviewers think it's stale as they're basically comparing apples to oranges there. I didn't really pay attention to the prices because I had a coupon
column6: but they send coupons in the mail all the time
column7: so people should keep a lookout for those. Even though you can get a bigger sub elsewhere for cheaper
column8: these subs are heartier and therefore way more filling. I can eat a footlong sub at Subway with little effort
column9: a regular sub from Jersey Mike's
column10: not as easy! That's a good thing!,

column1: 1_43FZHx3P5D7X-CpIR9WA,Subs are okay. A little better than Subway but priced much higher.  But here's why they get 1 star: I paid $30 for 3 adults and a child
column2: which is fine. A little high
column3: but whatever. I didn't leave a tip because I didn't feel one was warranted.   The guy taking my payment (or another employee) obviously didn't agree because today
column4: on my bank statement
column5: there is an initial authorization for $30 and a final charge of $33. So they gave themselves a $3 tip without my authorization.  I sent a message through the site and have received no response. That was about 7 hours ago.,

column1: 1_43FZHx3P5D7X-CpIR9WA,I love jersey mikes so much more than subway. I don't think I can ever eat subway again. The prices are a little higher but worth the money and you can add avocado to any sub with no extra cost.,

1_43FZHx3P5D7X-CpIR9WA,I love jersey mikes so much more than subway. I don't think I can ever eat subway again. The prices are a little higher but worth the money and you can add avocado to any sub with no extra cost.,

1_43FZHx3P5D7X-CpIR9WA,Stopped in Sunday for lunch after a high recommendation from a friend of mine in San Diego.   She claimed it was the best sub she's ever had so I had to try it.  Unfortunately my sub came up short with lack of taste and toppings.  When we pulled up I noticed it was super busy and was thinking man they must have great subs for it to be so packed.  Was lucky to get a booth inside but it wasn't as clean as others have stated in other reviews.  I had to take one of their comment cards and wipe the table of all crumbs on the ground as others had obviously done from the looks of the floor.  I had the Chipotle Cheese Steak sub that I split with my husband.  The bread tasted ok
column2: but it wasn't fresh out of the oven. They skimpt on the steak and hardly saw any onions at all on it.  For the price of the sandwich I really was expecting to get more.  The sauce was the best thing about it but I was wanting more of it as well.  I won't be going back.  Sad that it wasn't a better first impression.,

column1: 1_43FZHx3P5D7X-CpIR9WA,This place was overpriced and not that good. The bread tasted old and stale
column2: the meat was alright
column3: there are just a lot better options if you want to spend $13 on a meal. The only reason I have two stars instead of one is because the workers were really nice and helpful
column4: it's not their fault the sandwiches they're serving are not quality.,

column1: 1_43FZHx3P5D7X-CpIR9WA,This place is just an over priced subway. 25.00 for two subs and drinks! Ahhh! GET REAL!!!,
1_43FZHx3P5D7X-CpIR9WA,Awesome sandwiches. The quality is great and they are consistent. The staff is friendly and helpful. But they are expensive
column2: very expensive.,

column9: as always

column2: I love me some In-N-Out!  It's definitely over hyped
column3: but the food is consistently delicious. They do the best job of lettuce wrapping burgers around

column5: which explains the fabulous customer service.   Haha
column6: give me a break
column7: it's almost non existent ... At least at this location recently.   Seeing as this In-N-Out is by my office
column8: it's convenient and I used to come here often when I was a young

column10: Protein Style

I asked twice to make sure she noted Protein Style. Dirty looks and a yes. Practically threw my card and receipt back at me.   When I looked at my receipt
column12: I saw it wasn't listed. Kevin calls me up to grab my order
column13: and I asked if this was done Protein Style. He said no but would happily remedy this.   Usually Four stars for the food. Four stars for Kevin
column14: ZERO stars for Kayla.   I don't come here very much
column15: but I will likely stick to the In-N-Out on Chandler and Price from here on out when I decide to indulge.  Sorry for the two star rating
column16: In-N-Out
column17: but maybe you should consider removing this superbrat from a customer facing position or not hiring these types all together.,

column1: 3Q7vtF_cdHGyp2JOlKcu-Q,"Cheap
column2: fast
column3: great quality food. I'm from the east coast and never understood the in n out hype but now I can say I am officially a convert. I think my boyfriend saying \this tastes like a burger I would take off the grill at home\"" sums the food up perfectly. It's not your typical frozen
column4: preservative laden piece of meat. On top of that
column5: the fries are fresh cut daily and are delicious. Would eat this over the other big name fast food joints any day of the week.""",

column1: 3Q7vtF_cdHGyp2JOlKcu-Q,Well what can I say but this place put every other burger joint to shame in terms of fast food. It's also extremely cheap for what you get so if you need fast food on a budget you want it to still taste good go here,
18oecrR4bf-ctLvVGEaSLg,I admit it -- I had high expectations going to In-N-Out for the first time. I heard great things about their burgers
column2: and I was hoping to get blown away. I was not. Now on the plus side
column3: I love watching whole potatoes get smashed through the french fry press. That alone was worth the price of the meal. In fact
column4: I'd love to get one of those for my house. But the burgers? Not so much. I ordered the double-double
column5: and it was OK
column6: but not really unique or outstanding in any way I could taste. For my money
column7: a Big Mac is not something I can easily replicate at home (unlike the double-double)
column8: and the Burger King Whopper just tastes better. But that's just my two cents. I didn't hate it
column9: but I certainly can live without it.,

column1: 18oecrR4bf-ctLvVGEaSLg,"The first time I ate at In-N-Out was when the chain first popped up in the Phoenix area. I wasn't too impressed. I had a plain cheeseburger
column2: and it seemed like just your typical fast food burger. This was before I knew about the now not-so-secret menu.   I went in again to try their burgers again
column3: this time ordering a cheeseburger- animal style
column4: with a Neapolitan shake. The burger had a soft bun to go with the grilled burger meat
column5: melted cheese
column6: crisp lettuce and fresh tomatoes. Animal style is the way to go
column7: because of the extra depth of flavor from the mustard-grilled burger
column8: extra pickles
column9: and chopped caramelized onions. The extra thousand-island type sauce helps too.  Compared to other fast food chains
column10: you get a really good value for your meal here. The extra ingredients for \animal style\"" don't cost any extra
column11: and the burger meat tastes way better than something similar for the same price elsewhere. The veggies were very fresh
column12: as opposed to the wilted veggies you find in some places from burgers sitting out on heat lamps for who knows how long.  The neopolitan shake was pretty tasty. It's another \""secret menu\"" item
column13: and while I've never had a chocolate
column14: strawberry
column15: and vanilla shake all in one
column16: this will not be my last!  I wasn't too impressed with the fries
column17: despite being freshly cut and fried. They tasted a bit dry and crumbly.   Service was very friendly
column18: and the cashier even gave me a cup for water while we waited the few minutes it would take for our meal to be made. Once we were done
column19: another staff member came by to clear our table. Very nice service for a fast food place!""",

column1: 18oecrR4bf-ctLvVGEaSLg,So fast food restaurants aren't a big deal to me much anymore.  I mean

column4: my go to places for fast food is probably this or Wendys.  So anyways
column5: with this being probably around my 10th time coming here
column6: I recently got the 4x4 (for the 2nd time).  The burgers really do never disappoint (for the price anyways)  It's a solid

column10: I'm usually still hungry or hungry again 2-3 hours later.  If you are misreading the review

column1: 18oecrR4bf-ctLvVGEaSLg,Greatest burgers in the world!! Not expensive either. I could eat eat here everyday!,

column1: fVVpTBLOHZDH4AIACjO4kg,Eat More Chicken  Chick-fil-A is always very clean
column2: surprisingly calm
column3: fast food restaurant with friendly
column4: efficient staff.  The menu at Chick-fil-A has a  wide variety of choices including healthy ones.  In addition
column5: to the great selections from the menu you just can not beat the service.  The employees at Chick-fil-A are nicest folks around.  Attentive to your every whim
column6: and eager to please.     If you decide not to dine in the drive thru provides quick and efficient service on the run and if you decide to dine in - the kids have a place to play while you can sit an relax.   All in all a good meal at reasonable price.,

column1: fVVpTBLOHZDH4AIACjO4kg,"Really disappointed. Me and my son went thru the drive thru at Dysart location here in West Phoenix

column4: \ this is not what I remember.\"" I tried calling and of course they were closed. My son had just gotten off off work and was hungry so he ate his two sandwiches and I lost my appetite
column5: and am so upset I put my food in the bag and will wake up extra early tomorrow to take it back and speak to manager. If they want to leave early they shouldn't make a batch and let them sit there

column7: I paid 18.00 for two #1 combos and extra sandwich

column9: if someone gets paid 9.00 and hour they had to work 2 hours tp pay for that
column10: if they earn 18.00 it's still an hour of work to pay for your food
column11: forget about minimum wage! Lets remember they are taking more taxes from our checks now

SaIX7eay0vV-FxGPqTk1yA,I truly enjoy the fire roasted chicken here.  The price is affordable and well worth the money.  I am somewhat luke warm with regards to dark meat which they seem to promote.  The side dishes are good and they have free salsa in the condiment area.  Fries typically take a few more minutes to prepare.  Good overall.,
SaIX7eay0vV-FxGPqTk1yA,What Happened to this place? High prices and bad food...,

KXvkoGg5Od9Iwk4LMBFJ4w,Federico's is certainly good for a cheap Mexican place. I place it well above any of the 'bertos places I've tried. You get quite a bit of food for your money especially on Tuesdays
column2: where some of the tacos and burritos are $1 or $2.  The Green Chili Burrito is my favorite item on the menu by far with the Carne Asada Fries following a close second. I wouldn't recommend getting the Green Chili burrito to go if you have more than a 4 or 5 minute drive home as the sauce will ultimately soak through and you'll be left with a fairly soggy (yet very tasty!) mess in your wrapper. Eat this quick for best results or be prepared to use a fork if you hit any red lights on the way home.  As Jon K. said below
column3: the drive through is a nightmare. This is by far the most consistently slow drive through I've ever seen. If there are any other cars in the drive through
column4: you should head inside and place your order.  This isn't meant to be an extremely fancy place. It's like a cleaner Filiberto's that smells a lot nicer and has much better food.,

column1: KXvkoGg5Od9Iwk4LMBFJ4w,we go to this place often only because it's right around the corner from where we live and the price is okay and you get a helluv a lot food.  we have never tried the drive thru.  we always dine in.  we have ordered different taco
column2: burrito combos and some bean & fries dish.  not the best food but above average for mexican fast food.  the service is okay and at times they mess up your order.  we never had any complications with fixing our orders.  just sitting and waiting to get our new orders.  if you are not in shape and love fried food this is the place.,

column1: KXvkoGg5Od9Iwk4LMBFJ4w,Well
column2: I've gone back to Federico's several times since my last review and they seem to have improved.  Thank God that RUDE lady doesn't appear to be working there anymore

column4: I still gotta have 'em

column6: and I like it more than the green sauce now.  If I could knock 'em on anything

column1: KXvkoGg5Od9Iwk4LMBFJ4w,Food is descent for the prices they started with. Now they overcharge. I recently ordered a carne asada burrito with beans and they charged me $7.14. My jaw dropped. They need to reevaluate their prices before they lose clientle.,

X-dpycbo5fy8AyoHCUCryA,This place was a little confusing for me.  There were no descriptions of the food so I was flying blind when I ordered the California burger.  I just assumed it would have something like avocado or ranch or fish or sunshine or eddie money....but it didn't.  Nothing California about this burger other than that's probably where the lettuce came from.  Speaking of lettuce
column2: this burger had it with some uncooked onions and a tomato.  These aren't normally things I want on my burger but
column3: apparently
column4: that's what constitutes a California burger.  It was more expensive than a regular burger because of the toppings.  Nice.  Since I failed to realize any of this at the time
column5: I was still pretty hungry when I finished.  Since this is a steak-burger place
column6: they like to flatten out the beef until it looks like the sole of your shoe.  It's pretty thin and not very filling.  The taste is good and it's not greasy (unlike Steakenburger) but I really wished I had ordered a double.    The fries were actually really good which made me really happy.  I ended up putting some on my burger just to try and give it some more substance.  Not bad.  Feels like I'm back in Pittsburgh.  Anyways
column7: I probably wouldn't go back here but who knows?  It was better than Five Guys so they have that going for them.  It was a pretty ho-hum experience and that's probably what you'll get too.,

column1: X-dpycbo5fy8AyoHCUCryA,Freddy's is a good place to eat
column2: when you hit them on the right night. We have been here 4 times in the past few months and it's either hit or miss. They always seem to pack the place
column3: but that may be because of the price and the fact that we go on the weekend when there seems to be a car show taking place :)  Over all it's burgers and hot dogs. They are famous for their frozen custard which is awesome!  Last night the fries were very oily
column4: I could actually see the wetness in them. They were good
column5: but thinking about the oil was a tough one to swallow down.  I got a single burger plane with grilled onions last night
column6: unfortunately not many onions :(  We will continue to go back
column7: primarily because it's economical for a family of 4 and also the atmosphere is pretty neat.,

column1: X-dpycbo5fy8AyoHCUCryA,Great steakburgers!  Awesome flavor ! Much cheaper than 5 guys and their insane prices!,
X-dpycbo5fy8AyoHCUCryA,Great steakburgers!  Awesome flavor ! Much cheaper than 5 guys and their insane prices!,

X-dpycbo5fy8AyoHCUCryA,"Great service. However the food was such a bad deal I will never go back. Way over priced and the \custard\"" is not custard at all. If u want real custard then go to Ritas. Don't go here if you are hungry. I just was very disappointed.""",
X-dpycbo5fy8AyoHCUCryA,Freddy's was a pretty decent place for burgers and fries
column2: but they fell a little short of being great for me.  The burgers tasted high quality but they were severely lacking in seasoning.  I loaded it up with salt and a bit of pepper and things were made better.  The fries are shoestring fries so they're nice and crisp.  I really enjoyed them
column3: but again
column4: lacking in seasoning.  Their prices are fair
column5: especially considering the stupid 5 Guys is pretty close to them.  Just to compare
column6: I had a comparable burger here plus fries AND a drink
column7: all for the price of a single patty burger at 5 Guys.  I probably won't come back here mostly just because there are so many other similar places and this just doesn't stand out.,

column1: X-dpycbo5fy8AyoHCUCryA,Tasty moist flavorful burgers.   Wonderful thin crispy fries with minimal grease.   We've been back several times and will keep returning.  Prices reasonable.   Fast service
column2: order takers know contents of menu items.  Appreciate this knowledge with having food allergies. Employee even cleared table of tray and baskets
column3: nice touch.  Deserts look great
column4: need to go just for desert
column5: portions have been so good I don't get desert.  The only thing I would change is soda choice
column6: personally prefer Coke to Pepsi.,

column1: X-dpycbo5fy8AyoHCUCryA,Freddy's is not a restaurant for the health conscious
column2: those with finicky tummies
column3: or people who dab their pizza with napkins. Grease is ubiquitous at Freddy's
column4: it's like a inescapable condiment. Hell
column5: the soda is greasy.  If this bothers you
column6: you may want to eat somewhere healthier. Like anywhere else in the world.   But
column7: damn
column8: these burgers are good. They fry them up on a griddle until they're just a bit crispy around the edges while still being juicy and tender in the middle. Your options are pretty limited
column9: cheese or no cheese

column12: which seems to be popular these days
column13: but I prefer a little thicker cut. Still good though

column18: with just a hint of egg underneath the vanilla or chocolate flavor. Really
column19: really delicious. Like everything here

column21: it's about as good as Culver's or any other steakburger joint for the regular stuff
column22: but the frozen custard really makes it stand out as a favorite.,

column2: and well priced. Love the really skinny fries. Custard is above average
column3: but I'd go back anytime for the burgers.,

column3: it hit the spot

column8: might have to come back and try a burger!,

column1: X-dpycbo5fy8AyoHCUCryA,Their chili cheese fries are to die for!  Be sure to ask for a side if fry sauce to either drizzle over them or at least just dip the somewhat dry fries in at the end.  The burgers are tasty
column2: but I'd prefer In n Out's small patty burgers over these especially for the cost.   What keeps me going back is the cleanliness of the restaurant. The friendliness of the staff
column3: oh and did I mention the fry sauce?!?,

column1: X-dpycbo5fy8AyoHCUCryA,Flat patties
column2: tasteless
column3: expensive. I will never eat here again.,

column2: Gilbert.  The food and prices are so- so.  This last time we were there
column3: I ordered chicken tenders (dry
column4: overcooked and a very small portion at that) My fries were so salty I could hardly eat them \and I like salty fries\"".  My husband had their hot dog and it wasn't hot almost cool in the middle !!!  So not real sure what to make of it.  But to be fair
column5: the service was GREAT the girl at the counter was very pleasant
column6: and the ordered came correct...Just not real good.""",

column1: X-dpycbo5fy8AyoHCUCryA,Freddy's is totally grub. I'm down with the Double California Burger which is Freddy's take on an In & Out burger. I love how the meat hangs an inch out of the bun and the texture of the meat is so different from other burgers. The frozen custard is tasty and not that expensive. The kids and I get the dirt & worms and fight over the gummi worms. This place will satisfy the occasional greasy gut bomb craving. I'm looking forward to trying the Chicago dog and chili cheese fries.,
X-dpycbo5fy8AyoHCUCryA,Great steakburger's and the best fries.     In my opinion their custard is the best.  Inexpensive and good staff.     Great to have them in the community.,

X-dpycbo5fy8AyoHCUCryA,I went here with a friend last week for the first time. The employees are very friendly and kind. I was impressed with all the choices of flavors for the frozen custard. My friend ate dinner and I had dessert. Very delicious custard and not too expensive either. I'll be back- the food and service were wonderful!,
X-dpycbo5fy8AyoHCUCryA,"Quality burger and fries
column2: nothing mind blowing. The chili is really tasty but a little pricey for \fast food.\"" Bonus points for the fry sauce dispensers inside.""",

column1: K2_Hmmo5crTYWiT_1sWnfQ,Chipotle is probably my favorite fast foot chain. The food is always high quality even if it's obviously a lot higher in sodium and calories than they'd like to admit. Everything tastes good and fresh. If you go at a busy time
column2: it also feels like the line always moves fast
column3: too.   But there's too big things that keep me from giving it five stars. The first was raising their already high prices last year. I don't like that I can buy a Burrito at a sit-down restaurant for nearly the same price.  The other is how they charge you for everything. Not only are items like chips and guacamole extra
column4: but they come in huge sizes. If you're going to charge me for a big scoop of guacamole
column5: at least offer me a half size for cheaper.,

column1: K2_Hmmo5crTYWiT_1sWnfQ,What a disappoinment. I eat chipotle at least 5 days out of the week. Its healthy and delicious. I live in Old town Scottsdale so the location on Scottsdale road is where i always go. But
column2: tonight i happened to be coming back from a friends house closer to this one. Since it was on the way i decided to stop here instead of waiting to be closer to home. MISTAKE. The woman who kept bouncing between the cashier and the food line was rude (btw
column3: clearly the cashier girl didnt know what she was doing..but we'll get to that later). I asked her for a vegetarian salad with the rice on the side...she put it in a portion cup and i told her i was sorry and i prefer it to be placed in a bowl instead  ( i hate the rice all smashed) she proceeded to tell me it was an extra charge. (So to have my rice on the side costs more?! I told her the chipotle by my home never charged me and she said theres nothing she can do. Wow
column4: great customer service. Then i ordered chips and salsa and was charged again for an extra.salsa. it took  while for the cashier girl to even get my order rung up correctly. For someone who eats chipotle sooo much
column5: you will NEVER see me again at this location. Rude.rude.rude.,

column1: K2_Hmmo5crTYWiT_1sWnfQ,I have to give them a 5 for their Guacamole and chips. I am just in love with it.  Everytime I go to the US
column2: I have to go there. Cheap
column3: super tasty and I love the salad bowl option they have (as I cannot eat wheat flour). The meat is always tasty and fresh and again .....their guacamole ....the best !!!!  Always clean and fresh with friendly staff.  Healthy fast food .....  Just wish that we had it in Canada !!,

column1: Nc2TtVj6py6dHH_XdWAKRQ,"I guess I'll be the lone detractor of this overpriced dump. I travel through Casa Grande a couple of times a month
column2: saw them building this place and then decided to try it - having no clue what kind of food they serve.  Well
column3: it's  just another sub sandwich shop and a pathetic one at that.    You don't get to request whatever you want on your subs here
column4: they give you whatever they are going to put on it
column5: including slathering it with enough mayonnaise to make 5 sandwiches with and there is no option to have your sub toasted.  I ordered a Turkey sub and a medium - eegee I guess they call that drink  of which there are only 3 flavors available (from what I can see
column6: it's a glorified shaved ice drink).  The manager was at the register and asked what kind of cheese I wanted on it.  I told him cheddar
column7: not knowing and him not informing me that for a 12 inch sub
column8: they are going to add another $1.05 to the price for cheese!  The cheese
column9: btw
column10: was gross.  Like that imitation stuff you get at a grocery store that comes in slices
column11: nasty.    I got the sub and the drink - we're talking a 12 inch sub and a medium drink - and the bill was $11.10!! That's just plain outrageous! You don't even get a bag of chips with it for that much money
column12: chips are extra!  The sub was perfectly bland
column13: just another Jimmie Johns style sub excepting not as good as that (and I don't like Jimmie Johns).  After eating this thing and the drinking the drink
column14: my stomach started getting upset.  After 15 minutes

column16: but I'm not sure.  I had to sit there for 20 minutes before the feeling finally subsided and I could start driving again.    There was absolutely NOTHING special about this place OR it's food.  If you really want a sub and are in Casa Grande

column1: xM5F0cLAlKWoB8rOgt5ZOw,I went for my first time today and ordered a barbacoa burrito. It made me sick.  Cons Cold tortilla Cold and Flavorless barbacoa Beans tasted like plastic bottle caps Salsa had a weird taste    Pros The little red tray where they put your burrito on The guacamole   I know it's fast food but I just don't find what's so exciting about this place. For toppings they have three types of salsa

column1: XJc9Ueb3avGpYaj5Ll92hg,"Try their \hot sauce\"" on your burger. Good!  This particular five guys is fairly new.  My family likes the fries when they're hot.  The burgers aren't cheap
column2: but they are very good and the toppings selection is also very good.  The drink dispensers are a family favorite.  They love mixing flavors with their Sprite or Coke.  It's a God-awful dirty mess in there with Peanut shells and dirty tables everywhere as they try to keep up.  It's your typical 5 Guys.  if you like them
column3: you won't be disappointed in this one.""",

column1: XJc9Ueb3avGpYaj5Ll92hg,This newest Five Guys opened up the street from my house about three months ago & I finally got around to giving it a try tonight.  I ordered their regular burger with raw onion
column2: pickle
column3: tomato
column4: ketchup
column5: mustard
column6: green peppers
column7: Jalepeo peppers & mushrooms.  My order was ready in a short little while
column8: served up by the very friendly staff in a bright
column9: clean
column10: comfortable atmosphere
column11: with cool oldies playing & free peanuts on the side.  YUM
column12: YUM
column13: YUM!!  IT WAS AN EASY 5 STARS FOR THIS BIG
column14: AWESOME BURGER priced at $5.59.     :-)),

column1: XJc9Ueb3avGpYaj5Ll92hg,So my son and I decided we hadn't been to Five Guys in a long while - like over a year.  Went there tonight around 720pm and there were equal numbers of employees to customers - about 5 each.    Two burgers
column2: one a double cheeseburger the other one a regular cheeseburger and one big order of fries.  Dropped $25 bucks.  Only one person ahead of us but took about 4-5 minutes for their order (for 2 people).  Even though the place was not busy - the employees seemed more interested interacting with each other than customers.  Got done ordering and was waiting.  Young lady came back into the place 2x's working to get her order correct...made my spidey sense go off.  We got our order to go and headed out  - didn't want to deconstruct and reconstruct the contents of the bag..  Got home and both burgers were doubles
column3: and one of them didn't have onions (contrary to the order).    Mediocre at best but for a Scottsdale level price.   Oh well
column4: I think the next period that we go dark for Five Guys will be much longer than the last.  Habit is very good alternative.,

column1: XJc9Ueb3avGpYaj5Ll92hg,"This chain sure is full of itself with signs everywhere declaring how their burgers were voted best of all-over-the-place. Fine
column2: we get it
column3: people voted for chains in their \best of\"" votes.  A sign for their potatoes too. They bought potatoes from a farm in Idaho
column4: how bold of them.   A burger has two patties and a cheeseburger has two patties and some cheese.   Ridiculous amounts of fries. Extra fries help ensure we all stay fat. Thanks.  It's refreshing to tell someone what you want on your burger and they get it right.  7 minute parking for \""snappy\"" people. Sign is funny but 7 minutes doesn't seem like a realistic time since it probably takes that long for them to cook your burger.  $16 for fries
column5: a cheeseburger and a hamburger. The quality is there in the beef but the bun sucks for that price. I want a kaiser roll or some sourdough punk!   Lot's of hype. No best of anything ever from me.""",

column1: XJc9Ueb3avGpYaj5Ll92hg,Great juicy burgers and amazing fries at a great value! Five Guys is the standard I set for any burger or fries I eat elsewhere. The staff is friendly and quick with your order. The place is clean
column2: with lots of wooden tables for seating. There's also tables and umbrellas outside for additional seating. This store also has fancy Coke machines.   The food here is delicious and reasonably priced. I will definitely be back for more!,

column1: XJc9Ueb3avGpYaj5Ll92hg,"Decent burgers and a mountain of fresh and tasty fries...At a price....  One of a group of different burger chains that have sprouted up in the valley over the last few years.  The burgers are cooked on a griddle and topped with your options of toppings at no extra cost (except for bacon)
column2: and are hot and juicy.  The bad.    How can you give dozens of choices for toppings and only have American cheese (which most foodies would not even consider actual cheese).  Where is the swiss and cheddar?  Secondly
column3: the price you pay is a bit high.  My bill alone came to $14.85 (bacon cheeseburger
column4: soda & fries)
column5: which is almost what you would pay at a high end steak place for a much better burger and fries.    Even at my favorite burger restaurant
column6: I get a 1/2 pound burger
column7: fries and a drink for only $10.85
column8: that is $4 cheaper for a flame-broiled burger.  For those of us on a budget
column9: it is not worth the extra cost to come here.  During my visit the place was also filled with smoke
column10: and the doors were wide open.  I don't know if there was an issue with the ventilation system or they were just trying to give the place a more \downtown-like\"" (polluted) atmosphere.  One last thing...  I love that they use the quote \""The best $5 burger a man can get\"" to advertise the place
column11: when the cheapest (normal) burger they sell starts at $5.99!""",

column1: XJc9Ueb3avGpYaj5Ll92hg,"Finally got to try this place out after thinking about it for a while. I have to say we were pleasantly surprised. This is probably one of the better fast food burgers I've had in a while. Yes
column2: the buns were generic
column3: but it was awesome to eat a non-greasy fast food burger that didn't sit like a 10lb gut bomb. Hubby loved that mushrooms and jalapenos on the regular burger don't cost extra.  The mini burger (or whatever it is called) is 1 patty while the regular sized burger is 2. 1 patty was plenty for both me and the hubby. The fry portions are GENEROUS. We went to order a large fry and the cashier taking our order kindly informed us that a large was sized to feed 4-5 people. The small portion of fries was plenty for the two of us. They were served in a brown paper bag and we doused them with malt vinegar and some extra salt. They were delicious and not too greasy.  Prices are pretty reasonable- 2 mini (but sufficient) burgers
column4: and an order of fries was about $12 after tax. With drinks or larger burgers that price would have gone up
column5: but that's the case anywhere that doesn't do \meal deals\"".  Word to the allergic- peanuts are served at the door and kept in open boxes at the front of the restaurant. I didn't see any signs warning about this before you go into the restaurant
column6: which was a bit disappointing since peanut allergies can be so severe.""",
